excerpts: Miso Soup, and my choice of two maki (Hamachi Nega Maki, Spicy Tuna Roll), brought out well crafted fare that was light, fresh, and satisfying.
miso soup.author: Tracey A.
miso soup.review:
Hiding in plain sight, I've easily walked past Takara Sushi 150 times and finally just learned that they're open for lunch.  People are constantly asking me where to go for lunch in the Castro and now that I know that Takara serves it, I've added it to my list of suggestions.  

If you're in the Castro, seeking well-priced Japanese food for lunch, here's your place.

I understand that Takara does a bustling business at night which might account for the tired look of it during mid-day.  The tables were worn and the place looked bleak enough that I had a moment of hesitation on whether I really wanted to try their raw fish.  The moment passed, I overlooked the interior, ordered, and crossed my fingers.

Trust.  I was rewarded.

For around $10.50, the lunch menu offers a Bento box as well as a combination sushi lunch which I opted for.  Miso Soup, and my choice of two maki (Hamachi Nega Maki, Spicy Tuna Roll), brought out well crafted fare that was light, fresh, and satisfying.  A steaming cup of green tea reinvigorated me almost enough to step back out into a day of rain.

It's nothing fancy during the daytime but their offering is satisfying and I've no doubt I'll return.  Takara Sushi?  Nice to finally see you.

excerpts: My tempura came with a small slice of eggplant, small slice of zucchini, a piece of broccoli, a slice of sweet potato (I think), and one tempura shrimp including a small salad, rice, and miso soup.
miso soup.author: Christina C.
miso soup.review:
I've only been here once during lunch and they were closing in an hour. Two of my friends and I ordered from the lunch menu and the price is decent for a Japanese restaurant but I have to say that the portions are a bit on the smaller side. I got a bento box with 2 items; salmon shioyaki and tempura. It was good but nothing spectacular. My tempura came with a small slice of eggplant, small slice of zucchini, a piece of broccoli, a slice of sweet potato (I think), and one tempura shrimp including a small salad, rice, and miso soup. 

However, one of my friends ordered their tempura udon and that looked so good! I was immediately regretful of my decision and wished I had ordered that! She said it was very delicious and would recommend so my guess is that you would probably get more of a bang for your buck ordering the udon. 

The waiter was very kind and helpful though! I think I would try this place again for the udon but probably wouldn't go out of my way for it.

excerpts: but I will only be ordering Sushi and miso soup.
miso soup.author: Zoe Z.
miso soup.review:
This place serves quality sushi. The nigiri is fantastic. Specifically the salmon is excellent. I couldn't be more pleased. The only issues I will mention is that the goyza wasn't as fantastic as I hoped. Also the service was subpar, my meal was brought out 15 minutes before my guests.

I would suggest going between 430 and 6 PM on Sunday through Thursdays because you can get their discounted manual where all the nigiri he is 2.50 a piece and appetizers are significantly discounted. You'll end up spending about half that you would otherwise.

I'll definitely be returning but I will only be ordering Sushi and miso soup.

excerpts: this place was around the corner from yoga tree, so i came and got a chirashi lunch special, which came w/ miso soup and salad.
you know this restaurant does not cater to an asian crowd if they give you a spoon
w/ your miso soup.
miso soup.author: Helen T.
miso soup.review:
sushi is hard to find on a sunday during lunchtime.  i had just finished a 1 hour and 45 min yoga class, so i definitely was hungry.  this place was around the corner from yoga tree, so i came and got a chirashi lunch special, which came w/ miso soup and salad.  you know this restaurant does not cater to an asian crowd if they give you a spoon w/ your miso soup.

the chirashi was fine, but it was a bit skimpy.  i think the rice could have used more seasoning/vinegar as well.  i was hungry, so i ate the whole thing anyway.

excerpts: I ordered the spicy tuna roll, red dragon roll, and miso soup.
The rolls were just okay.
The tuna didn't have much flavor.
The rice was cooked well however.
The price point for the sushi was pretty average for San Francisco standards.
I would give Takara another shot and try something different next time.
miso soup.author: Josh S.
miso soup.review: Takara has friendly and attentive staff in a comfortable and cool looking restaurant.  The inside has two levels - the floor has tables by the front windows and the raised level up the steps opens up to a larger dining area.  I ordered the spicy tuna roll, red dragon roll, and miso soup.  The rolls were just okay.  The tuna didn't have much flavor.  The rice was cooked well however.  The price point for the sushi was pretty average for San Francisco standards.  I would give Takara another shot and try something different next time.

excerpts:
The Verdict:
Good Miso soup and Decent Rolls, however you're coming here for the ambiance, food is overpriced for what it was.
I was craving sushi and this place was nearby Bi-Rite Creamery.
The waitstaff is fairly attentive
miso soup.author: Sargon J.
miso soup.review:
The Verdict:
Good Miso soup and Decent Rolls, however you're coming here for the ambiance, food is overpriced for what it was. 
=============================================
Dropped in on a Wendesday 6:20pm I was craving sushi and this place was nearby Bi-Rite Creamery. 
The waitstaff is fairly attentive and I was welcomed in almost immediately.

Its not a large place, seats ~30 persons, once we were seated we were told to move since they wanted to reserve that one area for a large party at 7:30. I thought that was a bit odd, but reaffirmed that we would be finished before then. 

Onto the food: I had the dinosaur roll and my girlfriend had the vegetable tempura. I felt the price's were a bit steep and the portions to be underwhelming. I was planning to ask for a menu for another set of rolls, however the Dinosaur roll didn't increase my appetite. The fried crab was too dry and had very jerky-like texture to it. The vegetable tempura it what it is -- not sure how they can just charge $10+ for it but that isn't the point.

I do want to mention they have some really fresh ginger -- it was very potent and STRONK!

My experience:
Service : 3.5 / 5
It was meh, I think they had a new guy whom was pretty forgetful. Also being told to move shows that is some internal miscommunication occurring.
Food : 2.5 / 5
It wasn't bad per say but $30 for two mediocre rolls and one was a simple vegetarian roll? I definitely didn't feel like I got much value. 
Atmosphere: 4.5 / 5
Clean, well kept with a modern feel. I actually really liked the decor and the music too, however they were playing from an iPod (nothing wrong with that!) but the genre of music was inconsistent.


I feel that I have to draw attention to something unusual.... I was really taken-aback by how nice their bathroom was -- mainly the cleanliness & the large fresh sunflowers felt like I was in a home than a restaurant.

excerpts: Miso soup:
Good, strong broth, not watered down; the right amount of seaweed, green onion, and tofu.
miso soup.author: Adena B.
miso soup.review:
Walked in with the boyfriend on a random weekday for dinner. We were greeted and seated immediately.

Water glasses brought soon thereafter and orders taken quickly and efficiently. 

EATS
+Miso soup: Good, strong broth, not watered down; the right amount of seaweed, green onion, and tofu.
+Negi hamachi maki roll: Yellowtail with grreen onion. A small portion, but just how I like it.
+Unagi donburi: grilled freshwater eel over rice with unagi sauce. Tasty and filling: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/takara-sushi-san-francisco?select=IM15oB7zInJytQk2BfKRrg#IM15oB7zInJytQk2BfKRrg

All in all, a pleasant experience with good food and fair prices. Not bad for a sushi joint in the Castro.

excerpts: Just a ton of chicken with rice and a side salad and miso soup.
miso soup.author: Christina L.
miso soup.review:
Why is there such huge rating inflations for Asian food in the Castro? It's so terrible. Mama Ji's is overpriced and bad, and this place is no different.

I got the Tokyo Breeze, which had pretty good reviews on Yelp. It had avocado and lemon with tuna on top. They also season the roll with sesame oil and salt, which I thought was interesting. It tasted really weird though. The tuna was fresh, but the lemon just completely threw off the taste of the roll. It was incredibly sour. My friend had a bite of mine and made a weird face. It's very unexpectedly sour so beware. 

My friend got the chicken teriyaki dinner plate. It was very meh. Just a ton of chicken with rice and a side salad and miso soup. No cooked veggies or any kind of garnish.

We also got beer-- they have Asahi Black!!! If you've never tried it before, you have to get it. They poured it into this long fancy cup which looked nice. When we were done, we each asked for another one, and the waitress only came out with one beer
and strangely, she poured half into each of our cups and walked away before we could ask for another one... This was super weird. It's as if she was trying to restrict our alcohol consumption or something lol. We definitely made it really clear that we each wanted another beer... why would we want to share one???! On top of that, she immediately came out with the check which made us uncomfortable since we just got our drinks and wanted to enjoy it. And then 5 minutes later (we hadn't paid yet), she came back to our table and was like oops sorry and took the check away and then brought it back a couple of minutes later. I assume she forgot to add the beer in there or something.

Anyway, this was a super weird experience and a pretty mediocre meal. Only reason I'm giving it 2 stars instead of one is because they have Asahi Black.

excerpts: I got miso soup with clams, which was tasty, followed by Takara special and salmon skin hand roll.
I really liked all of it.
Yes, this girl can eat a lot!!!
Don't judge, don't judge...
miso soup.author: Marina S.
miso soup.review:
Love this place!!!  I live about a block away and have walked by many times. For some reason I was hesitant to try it. It can't be that good if it's so convenient, right??? Same premise as if it's too good to be true, it probably is. Wrong!!!  

The service is fast and friendly, the sushi is fresh and yummy, the presentation is creative, and the ambiance is cute. I keep seeing the sushi chef put out one gorgeous roll after another and I want to try them all!!!  My sake sashimi basically melted in my mouth. I got miso soup with clams, which was tasty, followed by Takara special and salmon skin hand roll. I really liked all of it.  Yes, this girl can eat a lot!!!  Don't judge, don't judge...I know where the gym is ;-). 

While it is still not my favorite sushi place in the City, I must say that I will make this my favorite neighborhood sushi joint. Can't wait to return!!!

excerpts: I ordered sushi and miso soup.
I began to become uncomfortable when I had to remind the waitress twice about the soup.
After a long wait in which no one appeared to give me more tea or bring my soup, the sushi finally arrived.
I reminded the male server--this is three times now--about the @$!!
miso soup.
miso soup.author: Earline A.
miso soup.review:
I finally tried Takara tonight.  I was seated across the aisle from a table of about eight twentysomethings who were inordinately loud and who spent 'way too much time discussing who had vomited and passed out on New Year's Eve.  If the servers had asked this table to keep their voices down a bit I would have been grateful, but that may be asking too much.   Unfortunately, it did not make for a pleasant dining experience.

Takara was a mixed bag for me.  There were two servers, a man and a woman, who seemed to alternate at my table.  I ordered sushi and miso soup.  I began to become uncomfortable when I had to remind the waitress twice about the soup.  After a long wait in which no one appeared to give me more tea or bring my soup, the sushi finally arrived.  I reminded the male server--this is three times now--about the @$!! miso soup.  He produced a bowl quickly, but I should have just canceled it.

The sushi was good and the presentation was lovely.  It is, as others have observed, on the price-y side.  Both the tea and the soup were very watery--the tea so much that I would have taken it for hot water if I hadn't seen it poured.

I'll be back, particularly since I live two blocks away and I would love dearly for Takara to tighten things up a bit.  If they do, I hope to be back to add a star to my review.  If not, there are plenty of other sushi restaurants.

excerpts: Miso soup with clams was delicious and an unusual offering.
Sushi presentations were beautiful.
Fresh wasabi
- we couldn't get enough!
Freshest, crispiest tempura ever!!
miso soup.author: Teresa S.
miso soup.review: Nice place, great food, great service!!  We had a really good time, thanks in part to our server Betty.  She was really fun.  Miso soup with clams was delicious and an unusual offering.  Sushi presentations were beautiful.  Fresh wasabi - we couldn't get enough!  Freshest, crispiest tempura ever!!  Try the pumpkin roll - spicy scallop with succulent salmon wrapped around; or the Japonese with the crunchy cracker base.  Love the dark wood decor, gave the place a high-end feel.  The staff were very helpful with the birthday cake we brought.  Thanks Takara!

excerpts: Miso soup was fantastic.
miso soup.author: Frank L.
miso soup.review: Great value for lunch. Not the best sushi in town but really affordable. Miso soup was fantastic.

excerpts: My partner had to ask for a complimentary bowl of miso soup (otherwise $3).
miso soup.author: J. R.
miso soup.review:
Long Long LONG wait for *RAW* sushi. After placing our order at 8:10pm for 2 ppl, we received one california roll at 8:30 and the remaining 4 rolls more than 15 mins later after complaining to the waitress. My partner had to ask for a complimentary bowl of miso soup (otherwise $3). Needless to say, we missed the July 4th fireworks show.

Would I eat here again? Absolutely not. Especially not when you're in a rush.

Water refills are very timely though.

excerpts: A couple of cons though--the edamame wasn't good (at least for takeout), it was dry, shriveled, and saltless; the wasabi didn't have any heat; and finally, the spicy scallop roll had very little scallop in it (more cucumber than anything).
Cons aside, this will be my new go-to for in-home sushi
b/c
the quality of the fish is better than others nearby and I would anticipate that the edamame is better if you are eating it live in the restaurant.
edamame.author: R S.
edamame.review: Reviewing takeout order: Finally tried a new local take out place b/c the ones that do takeout or delivery near Noe Valley have been disappointing and underwhelming at best. I was really happy that the fish tasted very fresh and there were a lot of options. I will definitely order pick up from here again. A couple of cons though--the edamame wasn't good (at least for takeout), it was dry, shriveled, and saltless; the wasabi didn't have any heat; and finally, the spicy scallop roll had very little scallop in it (more cucumber than anything). Cons aside, this will be my new go-to for in-home sushi b/c the quality of the fish is better than others nearby and I would anticipate that the edamame is better if you are eating it live in the restaurant.

excerpts: The service and ambiance was remarkable and I found it pretty cool how they served edamame as a little appetizer for free .
Total was about $30 including tip .
Overall great experience
edamame.author: Sky C.
edamame.review: Ordered the Volcano Roll and the Salmon Lover Roll . Did not disappoint . Definitely would recommend this place . The service and ambiance was remarkable and I found it pretty cool how they served edamame as a little appetizer for free . Total was about $30 including tip . Overall great experience

excerpts: Service (5/5): Free edamame!
Portions are really tiny though and no refills.
We called in fifteen minutes before arriving and they were nice enough to hold a table for us.
edamame.author: Abby S.
edamame.review:
Food (4/5): I shared the snow roll and the chef's sashimi with a friend. Snow roll has tempura shrimp and unagi inside, and crab, tobiko, and unagi sauce on the outside. Great combination of textures and flavors! The roll was pretty big, too.

 The chef's sashimi came with 3 slices each of 6 types of fish (tuna, salmon, scallop, walu, squid (?), and hamachi). Tasted pretty fresh, but the slices were really small.

Our other friend got the tempura udon, which came with a sizable portion of shrimp and veggie tempura. His food looked really good - I wished I ordered that! 

Service (5/5): Free edamame! Portions are really tiny though and no refills. We called in fifteen minutes before arriving and they were nice enough to hold a table for us. Servers were attentive and took care of us!

Value (4/5): Udon at ~$11 is prob the most value on the menu, but rolls ($6-14) aren't bad either. The chef's sashimi was $35 for 18 smallish pieces, which is okay too.

excerpts: Being that it was so long ago, the names of the sushi rolls escape me however I do remember that we were offered edamame and that the portion of the rolls were very small.
Taste of the rolls weren't worth remembering either.
edamame.author: Mabel Y.
edamame.review:
Almost a year ago, I came to Takara sushi with my boyfriend for dinner.

My first impression about Takara was that the restaurant was very clean and sushi bar like. We were seated immediately next to the window.

Being that it was so long ago, the names of the sushi rolls escape me however I do remember that we were offered edamame and that the portion of the rolls were very small. Taste of the rolls weren't worth remembering either.

excerpts: I love their Takara edamame as well as other sides like their poblano peppers and eggplant.
edamame.author: Jess L.
edamame.review:
I've been here twice with my two friends, who are frequenters of this restaurant, and I've only ever had stellar food and great service.

The salmon tartare is really nice and fresh. There are so many rolls to choose from (try X-Roll or Dragon). I love their Takara edamame as well as other sides like their poblano peppers and eggplant.

Everyone who works here is super nice, and I've never had a dish I didn't like!

excerpts: The water was flowing and the free edamame helped us get some food in our systems quick.
edamame.author: Kevin J.
edamame.review:
Not the best sushi I've ever had in San Francisco but I have to say that Takara held it's own.  The servers were friendly considering the drunk messes that stumble in every so often. My friend and I had grabbed a couple drinks before stumbling in ourselves and the waitress treated us amazingly even helping us pick out the best rolls on the menu.  The water was flowing and the free edamame helped us get some food in our systems quick.

I recommend a longer dinning experience for anyone next time, but this place dropped the food off quick so we could get in and out. Takara is a nice little gem in the Castro.  I'll for sure be back.

excerpts: They brought out edamame and water as soon as we sat down which was nice.
edamame.author: Rachel E.
edamame.review:
My sister and I came for dinner around 7:30 on Saturday night. It was empty when we arrived which made us a little nervous, but we decided to give it a shot. The restaurant did get significantly more crowded as it got a little later, but seems like at any time there's no wait for a table.

They brought out edamame and water as soon as we sat down which was nice. Then we had the kamikaze roll, x roll, salmon sashimi, and chicken udon.

The kamikaze roll was very good. I'm a big spicy tuna fan to begin with though! The x roll was also delicious, but I thought the sauce was overwhelming the rest of the roll. 

The salmon sashimi was super fresh, it's clear the quality of the fish is really good. 

The udon was fantastic too! The broth was amazingly flavorful and the noodles were perfectly cooked. The chicken in it was nothing to write home about. I'll probably try the beef next time. (Seafood is a little too adventurous for me...)

Service was just ok (hence just 4 stars instead of 5). Our waitress came by very quickly after we were seated and asked if we were ready to order. We told her we needed just another minute, but didn't see her for at least 10... Then, midway through our meal we overheard her telling the table next to us about some specials that weren't on the menu. We didn't hear about any specials...

Also, the water guy kept filling my glass. Literally every time I took a sip. It got to the point where it was actually disruptive to the conversation.

I don't mean to end on a negative note because this is a solid sushi place with some inventive rolls, tasty fresh fish, and friendly servers.

excerpts: I just ordered $60 worth of sushi and asked them to throw in some edamame (considering if you order from Grub Hub online, a minimum of $40, they give you free edamame) and the male staff member refused to give us edamame despite his knowledge of their having this offer through 3rd parties online.
Edamame is free at the table when you visit the restaurant, so I don't understand what the big deal is.
If he had offered me a double order of edamame, considering I'm more than a regular, I'd be writing a 5 star review right now, super happy.
edamame.author: Jordan Q.
edamame.review:
I am disappointed  with Takara's customer service and delivery this evening. I just ordered $60 worth of sushi and asked them to throw in some edamame (considering if you order from Grub Hub online, a minimum of $40, they give you free edamame) and the male staff member refused to give us edamame despite his knowledge of their having this offer through 3rd parties online. Edamame is free at the table when you visit the restaurant, so I don't understand what the big deal is. If he had offered me a double order of edamame, considering I'm more than a regular, I'd be writing a 5 star review right now, super happy.

Customer service 101.

Pissed and hungry and feeling robbed!

Think twice about ordering delivery.

excerpts: We were seated right away and served edamame and tea.
I was a little disappointed in the lack of vegetarian options on the menu, however they had a dragon roll and we had to try it!
edamame.author: Rachael J.
edamame.review:
Since going vegan late last year, I've been hesitant to go out to Japanese food since sashimi was a weakness of mine. Boy am I glad I went to Takara!! We were in the Castro to see a movie and only had about 45 minutes to eat. We were seated right away and served edamame and tea. I was a little disappointed in the lack of vegetarian options on the menu, however they had a dragon roll and we had to try it! We also ordered a few other rolls, some veggie tempura and a wakame salad.

Our food came out pretty quickly and it was all very tasty. The vegetarian dragon roll is to DIE for! Tempura tofu fills the roll and it's topped with Japanese eggplant and avocado, AMAZING! I told my husband I could just order dragon rolls on our next visit and be very happy! On top of the really awesome food, our service was friendly and prompt.  The sashimi options looked really good as well. If you're a vegan/vegetarian, I highly recommend this place! There aren't too many options, however, the ones on the menu are so worth checking this place out for.  It was pretty affordable, too, around $50 for two people (including beer).

excerpts: The place is petite, so not recommended for groups over 6, but everything from the welcome, the complimentary edamame, to the unwritten sake menu, and even the misspelled "dessert" header is awesome.
edamame.author: Andrew C.
edamame.review:
Takara Sushi prepares the best sushi in the Castro, hand(job)s down! The place is petite, so not recommended for groups over 6, but everything from the welcome, the complimentary edamame, to the unwritten sake menu, and even the misspelled "dessert" header is awesome. 

I really enjoy the rolls here - there's most of your typical rolls and a few specialty/proprietary rolls mixed in! I don't find the prices too expensive, but I guess others do? There aren't a lot of special discounts and maybe that's the reason.. 

Definitely a great casual date spot or sex-in-the-city boys-night-out place!

excerpts: Our plate of complimentary edamame had 9 pieces.
When the guest next to us sat down, they were given an entire bowl.
The "hot" tea was room temperature and wasn't stepped long enough.
My refill later was hot, but again flavorless.
Yes, I know these two things were "free", but my thing is, if you're going to do it, do it right and be consistent.
Although the servers were friendly, they came around way too much refilling our drinks.
Different servers came by one after the other every 3 minutes.
edamame.author: Melanie N.
edamame.review: Our plate of complimentary edamame had 9 pieces. When the guest next to us sat down, they were given an entire bowl. The "hot" tea was room temperature and wasn't stepped long enough. My refill later was hot, but again flavorless. Yes, I know these two things were "free", but my thing is, if you're going to do it, do it right and be consistent. Although the servers were friendly, they came around way too much refilling our drinks. Different servers came by one after the other every 3 minutes. The Pumpkin, Salmon Lover, Hamachi Nigiri, and the Maguro Tataki Salad were all delicious. However, I felt the Pumpkin was overpriced. They could have also been a little more generous with the size of the Salmon Lover. 3.5/4 stars overall.

excerpts: Your meal will start off right with some bottomless green tea and some edamame.
Delicious.
My suggestion is peruse the menu for one or two things, but then let your appetite follow the specials.
edamame.author: Douglas P.
edamame.review:
The best little sushi shop in the Castro. I think the best thing about this place is the woman who does a lot of the waiting. She's super friendly and helpful. If you're vegetarian or vegan, let her know early on, and she'll make suggestions. There are some vegetarian specials (or vegetarian versions of specials) that aren't on the board.

Your meal will start off right with some bottomless green tea and some edamame. Delicious. My suggestion is peruse the menu for one or two things, but then let your appetite follow the specials.

excerpts: I also order the Takami Edamame with olive oil instead of butter.
The wait staff is always very accommodating, willing to modify rolls or let you know which rolls are standard gluten-free.
They also provide gluten-free tamari soy sauce.
edamame.author: G B.
edamame.review:
I've had both lunch and dinner here six times in the past year...and plan to keep going!

Ambiance:  Warm and relaxed.

Service: Friendly and very accommodating for food allergies.

Food (gluten-free dairy-free perspective): The freshness of the seafood can be hit or miss but always within the range of fresh.  My favorite roll is the Tokyo Breeze.  I also order the Takami Edamame with olive oil instead of butter.  The wait staff is always very accommodating, willing to modify rolls or let you know which rolls are standard gluten-free.  They also provide gluten-free tamari soy sauce.

excerpts: We usually do take out, but the servers are always wonderful with my sons, offering them water and edamame if we have to wait for our order to be ready.
edamame.author: Lily T.
edamame.review:
A few months ago I broke down and went back to Takara - it's so convenient, and my sons love gyoza and sushi.  I was pleasantly surprised by how much it's improved.  I can't speak to the SF roll, since I usually get their chirashi-don, but their fish is consistently fresh and tasty, and their chirashi always has something new and interesting on it.  We usually do take out, but the servers are always wonderful with my sons, offering them water and edamame if we have to wait for our order to be ready.  

So: Go Takara!  I take back my two star review - you're my go-to take out sushi place in our 'hood!

excerpts:
Love their comp edamame they give you upon seating (they will refuse to give a refill ..bah
2.
edamame.author: NC B.
edamame.review:
This place has no seating, it is overly quiet, and is by far the smallest restaurant I have ever dined in....

But I really couldn't care less because their sushi is absolutely unrealistically DELICIOUS!!

PROS:

1. Love their comp edamame they give you upon seating (they will refuse to give a refill ..bah
2. THEIR VOLCANO ROLL IS THE MOST DELICIOUS THING MY MOUTH HAS EVER TASTED!!!!! From the crispness of the tempura to the juiciness and freshness of the sushi, to the wonderful presentation... SOOOO GOOD
3.their Philly roll is super yummy as well as their avocado roll...

CONS:
1. How can this joint not have HAPPY HOUR!!! Wtf. What a disappointment...
2. Location is very small and cozy and the awkward silence does not help... It's called music and you simply hit the ON button.

But again I really don't care.. This place deserves 5 stars all the way. Thank your VOLCANO roll. Best in town.

excerpts: The restaurant provides free edamame beans before your meal (love it because I always feel cheated when places try to sell me a tiny plate of edamame for $5), and the waiters are super attentive in refilling tea.
Seriously, I don't think my tea cup has ever gone empty...
they definitely have some magic tea radar up in here.
edamame.author: Jennifer L.
edamame.review:
Yummy neighborhood sushi joint 2 blocks away from me, what more could I ask for! I've eaten here about 4x now, and I've enjoyed every meal! 

Sashimi is always fresh, and they have a pretty good selection of food options to choose from. Here are some of the items I've had:
- Volcano Roll (5 stars): Eel/mango/tuna/salmon with some crispy flakes. Yum! Doesn't look like a traditional roll, but under all the crispy flakes, you'll find the delicious pieces of sushi, don't worry.
- Summer Roll (3.5 stars): A bit plain, but I like it when I'm trying to go for something simple and lighter since it's wrapped with soy paper and doesn't have any extravagant sauces on it.
- Dinosaur Roll (4 stars): Soft-shell crab goodness! Sometimes the soft shell crab is prepared better than others, but overall a solid roll.
- Spicy Tuna Hand Roll (5 stars): Good tuna with a perfect amount of spiciness.
- Eggplant Special (5 stars): Super delicious combo of scallop/eggplant/shrimp! Spicy miso sauce gives each bite a nice kick.
- Tempura Udon (2 stars): I got this via delivery since I was craving noodles so might not be a right indicator of the actual dish. But it didn't taste like anything special, and I would've liked a better assortment of tempura.
- Salmon sashimi appetizer (4 stars): Very smooth, but I usually let the bf eat all of this since it's his fave type of sashimi.

Additional pluses: I've never had to wait for a seat, and the prices are decent (prob can get out of here paying between $15-20/person). The restaurant provides free edamame beans before your meal (love it because I always feel cheated when places try to sell me a tiny plate of edamame for $5), and the waiters are super attentive in refilling tea. Seriously, I don't think my tea cup has ever gone empty... they definitely have some magic tea radar up in here.

excerpts: The positives: free green tea (yummie), free edamame (it was warm but good), and the bathroom was very clean.
edamame.author: Brian S.
edamame.review:
I had higher hopes for this place, but you can tell they are just opening up.  I hope they figure things out because the staff seemed like very nice people. 

The evening started with the host confused about where we should sit.  After looking at his watch and glancing at his supervisor, he moved us to the other side of the restaurant; no big.  

We ordered a King California roll, two spider hand rolls, a spicy tuna hand roll, two bowls of miso, and two glasses of water.  The crab in the King California roll had a strange texture and didn't taste that great.  The spicy tuna hand roll came 10 minutes after the first part of the meal.  We thought they forgot it, and when it came it had too much batter to actually taste anything.  The spicy tuna roll was ok.  The miso was good.  Finally, the water never came :(. 

The overall experience was awkward at best.  The interior of the restaurant is nice, through it seemed a bit too rigid.  The wait staff seemed to have no clue what was going on.  After the lead wait staff person asked how our evening went, I explained the issues.  If anything, I hope they can improve.  It has the potential to be a cool place to eat, but they need to improve some things.  I ended up eatting only one of the pieces of sushi and a bit of the spider roll to taste it;  I am still hungry.  Two stars for now, but I will try again in a couple of months if the restaurant lasts. 

The positives: free green tea (yummie), free edamame (it was warm but good), and the bathroom was very clean.  

The best part is the host delivered our check with a quiet "I am so sorry."  

Best of luck to your new business.

excerpts: I really shouldn't complain, but for full disclosure, the *free* tea was weak, and the *free* edamame to start was cold.
edamame.author: Mike W.
edamame.review:
I really shouldn't complain, but for full disclosure, the *free* tea was weak, and the *free* edamame to start was cold.

The red dragon roll was delicious and well presented, the extra orders of salmon nagiri were quick to come out and offered plenty of fresh salmon.

The staff was friendly, and they kept the water filled.

excerpts: Even the edamame were undercooked and inedible.
I'm giving them two two stars only because after calling to complain they refunded the money which was very reasonable of them.
edamame.author: J Z.
edamame.review: The sushi had no taste, the crab in the California roll tasted off, overall a waste of money. Even the edamame were undercooked and inedible. I'm giving them two two stars only because after calling to complain they refunded the money which was very reasonable of them.

excerpts: volcano roll and their seasoned edamame made the best appetizers.
prices are reasonable for the quality, every penny worth!
edamame.author: Michie Y.
edamame.review:
sashimi is super fresh there, my tai literally melted in my mouth. all others that i tried (uni, amaebi, salmon) were also very good (in taste and display). volcano roll and their seasoned edamame made the best appetizers. prices are reasonable for the quality, every penny worth! the owner and the people working at the sushi bar are also very friendly. 

this place is really for people that enjoy sushi. while there are many options where i can pay less for so-so rolls that can stuff my stomach, i would always come back for sushi.   

i think this place is even better than sushi ota in sd.

excerpts: I also order the Takami Edamame with olive oil instead of butter.
The wait staff is always very accommodating, willing to modify rolls or let you know which rolls are standard gluten-free.
They also provide gluten-free tamari soy sauce.
takami edamame.author: G B.
takami edamame.review:
I've had both lunch and dinner here six times in the past year...and plan to keep going!

Ambiance:  Warm and relaxed.

Service: Friendly and very accommodating for food allergies.

Food (gluten-free dairy-free perspective): The freshness of the seafood can be hit or miss but always within the range of fresh.  My favorite roll is the Tokyo Breeze.  I also order the Takami Edamame with olive oil instead of butter.  The wait staff is always very accommodating, willing to modify rolls or let you know which rolls are standard gluten-free.  They also provide gluten-free tamari soy sauce.

excerpts:
Ohitashi: very fresh and flavorful
Cucumber Sunomono: it tasted as good as it looked!
ohitashi.author: Alex M.
ohitashi.review:
From the second I walked in, everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful. I ordered all vegetarian dishes to go. While I waited they brought me green tea (on the house) and the woman informed me that they can make custom veggie rolls!

Ohitashi: very fresh and flavorful
Cucumber Sunomono: it tasted as good as it looked!
Veggie Tempura Roll wrapped in soy-paper: My new favorite roll!

Everything was packaged very carefully.

This is a great neighborhood spot I will return to over and over again. I am excited to learn they deliver as well.

excerpts: We also ordered a few other rolls, some veggie tempura and a wakame salad.
wakame salad.author: Rachael J.
wakame salad.review:
Since going vegan late last year, I've been hesitant to go out to Japanese food since sashimi was a weakness of mine. Boy am I glad I went to Takara!! We were in the Castro to see a movie and only had about 45 minutes to eat. We were seated right away and served edamame and tea. I was a little disappointed in the lack of vegetarian options on the menu, however they had a dragon roll and we had to try it! We also ordered a few other rolls, some veggie tempura and a wakame salad.

Our food came out pretty quickly and it was all very tasty. The vegetarian dragon roll is to DIE for! Tempura tofu fills the roll and it's topped with Japanese eggplant and avocado, AMAZING! I told my husband I could just order dragon rolls on our next visit and be very happy! On top of the really awesome food, our service was friendly and prompt.  The sashimi options looked really good as well. If you're a vegan/vegetarian, I highly recommend this place! There aren't too many options, however, the ones on the menu are so worth checking this place out for.  It was pretty affordable, too, around $50 for two people (including beer).

excerpts: Thankfully, she has a varied palate and eats up the wakame salad, sunomono, beef short ribs, soft shell crab and amazingly delicious misoyaki sea bass.
wakame salad.author: R. K.
wakame salad.review:
I really love this place.  At first blush, it does not seem to be kid-friendly.  But the staff is so very friendly and kind to my almost two year old daughter.  Thankfully, she has a varied palate and eats up the wakame salad, sunomono, beef short ribs, soft shell crab and amazingly delicious misoyaki sea bass.

For the adults, the sushi is grade A. I was a little skeptical at first b/c the chef and staff are Chinese and not Japanese, which is always not a good sign for a sushi restaurant.  But I was wonderfully surprised at the quality of the sushi.  Very very good.

This is my go to restaurant for sushi in the city, and not just b/c we live nearby.  

I would highly recommend Takara Sushi.

However, I felt the Pumpkin was overpriced.
They could have also been a little more generous with the size of the Salmon Lover.
3.5/4 stars overall.
maguro tataki salad.author: Melanie N.
maguro tataki salad.review: Our plate of complimentary edamame had 9 pieces. When the guest next to us sat down, they were given an entire bowl. The "hot" tea was room temperature and wasn't stepped long enough. My refill later was hot, but again flavorless. Yes, I know these two things were "free", but my thing is, if you're going to do it, do it right and be consistent. Although the servers were friendly, they came around way too much refilling our drinks. Different servers came by one after the other every 3 minutes. The Pumpkin, Salmon Lover, Hamachi Nigiri, and the Maguro Tataki Salad were all delicious. However, I felt the Pumpkin was overpriced. They could have also been a little more generous with the size of the Salmon Lover. 3.5/4 stars overall.

excerpts: The Spicy Tuna wrapped in Shiso and fried is exceptional along with the Shishito Peppers; hot and amazing!
shishito peppers.author: J B.
shishito peppers.review: Great friendly service. I recommend the appetizers. The Spicy Tuna wrapped in Shiso and fried is exceptional along with the Shishito Peppers; hot and amazing!  The Fire Ball rolls are oh so good.  Love this place and the staff !

excerpts: For my rolls I ordered the oshinko maki, and the vegetable dragon roll.
oshinko maki.author: DJ S.
oshinko maki.review:
I'm very particular about my sushi, and when I'm in San Francisco my go-to place is Kiji on Guerrero Street. However, this time I decided to make a reservation at Takara in the Castro neighborhood. I had heard great things about it, and while I am always skeptical about restaurants in the Castro I threw caution to the wind. Well the wind blew it back in my face.

I decided to go all vegetarian, and luckily Takara has a very nice selection of vegetarian options. The Cucumber Sonomono was the first disappointment. The vinegar tasted as if it has been diluted with water, most of the cucumbers had not even been dipped in the vinegar let alone soaked in it. I actually had to pour soy sauce over it, to be able to eat it. The vegetable gyoza was the next item up, and they were perfectly prepared, golden and crisp on one side and the vegetables inside bursting with flavor. For my rolls I ordered the oshinko maki, and the vegetable dragon roll.

The oshinko was crisp and perfectly pickled, unfortunately the nori that it was wrapped in was stale and tough. The dragon roll was probably the highlight of the night. Well prepared, the nori was fresh, and the avocado and eggplant prepared with perfection.

Now comes the worst experience in my restaurant life. The wait staff appeared to be on speed. I have never in my life felt so rush at a restaurant. No sooner did I place the last piece of food in my mouth, they were there snatching away the empty plate. I was in and out of the restaurant in 30 minutes. I left stressed and completely unnerved by the overly hyper staff.

It was the first and last time at Takara Sushi. Take a lesson from your four-legged world traveler. Don't go here. There are so many better places in the city to get really fine sushi and to do so in a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere. Keep walking my friends, keep walking.

With love from my dog bowl to yours...happy eating.

shatasdogbowl

excerpts: (got the avocado maki and sweet potato tempura roll).
The fish dishes looked amazing and seemed super inventive.

I will definitely come back.

The fish dishes looked amazing and seemed super inventive. They were also huge! I will definitely come back.

veggie dragon roll.review: Takara Sushi definitely has some delicious sushi. But the prices don't really align with the portions and the plates aren't overly aesthetically pleasing. The Veggie Dragon roll I had was great, but I'm not sure if I would want to pay $10.95 for it again.

2.

excerpts: The veggie gyoza were pretty good, but had little tiny pools of oil all over them, so ugh, gotta drop these guys to 2 stars.
veggie gyoza.author: Gabriela W.
veggie gyoza.review:
This is how I FELT after ordering delivery from here the first two times:

This is our go-to spot for sushi delivery.

I invite the Dragon Roll over at least weekly, no eggplant.

I ask for less rice, they hook it up. I ask for it to be packaged separately (not with my husband's sushi), and they hook it up. As a veggie, that's important to me.

They're always on time, even early. This matters when you're so hungry you're tempted to run outside and wait on the curb for your delivery.

This is how I FEEL after ordering lag-*** sushi from here the last two times:

Still on time, but seriously inedible. Did a sushiboss get fired, leave, or go on vacation???

Seems like it. 

My dragon roll moved in with NoFlavah. Yuck. Fuchi.

The veggie gyoza were pretty good, but had little tiny pools of oil all over them, so ugh, gotta drop these guys to 2 stars. That's me being generous, remember that.

Una estrella. Una nada mas.

My search for tasty sushi delivery continues.

Help me. Help me please.

Veggie Gyoza
3.
Veggie Joseph Mango Soy (Very creative and unique.

The rice was OK.

nigiri sampler.review:
I took the nigiri sampler. The fish was quite tasteless. The rice was OK. The wasabi was on the side, not between the fish and the rice. Definitely not worth the price.

I tried a piece of squash tempura from one of my friends and it was good.

excerpts: Takara special ( $26) was excellent.
takara special.author: Dani O.
takara special.review:
Good Sushi.
Takara special ( $26) was excellent.
Chicken udon ( $ 10.95) ) was good and filling.
Salmon rolls were fresh and tasty.
Overall good food.

excerpts: I got miso soup with clams, which was tasty, followed by Takara special and salmon skin hand roll.
I really liked all of it.
Yes, this girl can eat a lot!!!
Don't judge, don't judge...
takara special.author: Marina S.
takara special.review:
Love this place!!!  I live about a block away and have walked by many times. For some reason I was hesitant to try it. It can't be that good if it's so convenient, right??? Same premise as if it's too good to be true, it probably is. Wrong!!!  

The service is fast and friendly, the sushi is fresh and yummy, the presentation is creative, and the ambiance is cute. I keep seeing the sushi chef put out one gorgeous roll after another and I want to try them all!!!  My sake sashimi basically melted in my mouth. I got miso soup with clams, which was tasty, followed by Takara special and salmon skin hand roll. I really liked all of it.  Yes, this girl can eat a lot!!!  Don't judge, don't judge...I know where the gym is ;-). 

While it is still not my favorite sushi place in the City, I must say that I will make this my favorite neighborhood sushi joint. Can't wait to return!!!

excerpts: My favorite here is the Takara Special sushi sashimi combo.

It comes with four pieces of sashimi and four niguiri, but today the 4 pc of sashimi look like two regular pieces cut in to four, making them very small; really bad business, then when I told them this wasn't okay
I didn't get any excuse or apology, not even a gesture they'll make it better.
Guess what, this is the fourth time I go there and the last time also.
takara special.author: E M.
takara special.review: My favorite here is the Takara Special sushi sashimi combo. It comes with four pieces of sashimi and four niguiri, but today the 4 pc of sashimi look like two regular pieces cut in to four, making them very small; really bad business, then when I told them this wasn't okay I didn't get any excuse or apology, not even a gesture they'll make it better. Guess what, this is the fourth time I go there and the last time also.

excerpts: The third item I ordered was Amaebi.

This looked a lot better and unlike other sushi restaurants the raw shrimp does come with the fried shrimp heads, which we felt unless they give you the fried shrimp heads with this dish then you are missing out.
The shrimp heads were perfectly fried but of course they have trimmed its whiskers so there wasn't a lot of that to munch on.

Our fourth dish was the Baked Mussels and is good and pretty standard compared to other Japanese restaurants with the exception of Sushi Zone, which does the Baked Mussels perfectly and above standard, well worth the wait.
Our final dish was the raw oysters from Japan, the Shigoku oysters.
These were good and I do recommend trying these.
The oysters were clean, fresh, and sweet.
amaebi.author: Nana R.
amaebi.review:
You know there is something wrong with your dinner when you end up across the street and eat a second dinner. This place must be rating themselves or they wouldn't have fallen so flat. The sushi and sashimi was nothing to be amazed about. In fact, it was utterly disappointing. This place may try to look fancy but it is not up to par compared to other Japanese restaurants in the city. 

First, who sears O-toro especially when I ordered sashimi. If I wanted cooked fish I would order it. But I ordered sashimi and I expected a piece of raw fish but instead I end up with half cooked fish. Is there something wrong with it like maybe it was about to spoil thus you cooked it? After I ate my order of O-toro I began to wish I had not ordered it at all. It gave me a bad after taste and I felt it might have been spoiled because of the strong fishy smell, but not the good kind. Besides the O-toro I ordered Uni, which again is disappointing because the Uni looked pale yellow and is doused with soy sauce. I actually like my seafood nice and clean so the only garnish I really put on my raw seafood is a small dab of wasabi and that is IT. No soy sauce. So I was disappointed to see that the chef had put soy sauce over the uni. Another disappointment was that instead of one or two large pieces of uni placed over rice, I had small little bits almost what I consider the leftovers scraped off the bottom of the container stuffed on top of rice with some type of edible paper wrapped around it. It was utterly sad and I cannot start to describe the despair I felt when I saw it. But down the hatch it went and yeah, it really tasted like the dried up stuff scraped from the bottom of the container. 

Besides the disappointment I felt with the O-toro and the Uni there were a few items I was satisfied with. The third item I ordered was Amaebi. This looked a lot better and unlike other sushi restaurants the raw shrimp does come with the fried shrimp heads, which we felt unless they give you the fried shrimp heads with this dish then you are missing out. The shrimp heads were perfectly fried but of course they have trimmed its whiskers so there wasn't a lot of that to munch on. Our fourth dish was the Baked Mussels and is good and pretty standard compared to other Japanese restaurants with the exception of Sushi Zone, which does the Baked Mussels perfectly and above standard, well worth the wait. Our final dish was the raw oysters from Japan, the Shigoku oysters. These were good and I do recommend trying these. The oysters were clean, fresh, and sweet. They were garnished with a special sauce, fish eggs, and green onions. 

Overall, I will NOT be coming back. This is not my type of sushi restaurant where they mask the real flavors and colors of the seafood. If you liked sauced up sushi and half cooked seafood that your parents won't be too afraid to try then this is your place. But if you are into the raw, clean, and REAL sushi then go else where. Enjoy!

excerpts: half expected my hotate salad to show up soggy, but the mixed greens were great, with cherry tomatoes, slices of scallop, and there was just the right amount of yuzu vinaigrette.
The sake and hamachi nigiri were generous in size and also very fresh, and the 49er roll was perfectly fine (although a little boring).
hotate.author: Vivian W.
hotate.review:
I find it generally very hard to find good sushi delivery as the restaurants that offer delivery often seem to have rubbery fish.  Live Sushi Bistro has been my go to place for years, but the last few times, the quality has definitely gone downhill. So I started looking around for another sushi delivery option.  Thanks to Yelp, I found Takara.  

First order was great!  There's an easy online ordering process, it said food would be delivered in 45-60 minutes and it came at 52 minutes, and the sushi was very good.  half expected my hotate salad to show up soggy, but the mixed greens were great, with cherry tomatoes, slices of scallop, and there was just the right amount of yuzu vinaigrette.  The sake and hamachi nigiri were generous in size and also very fresh, and the 49er roll was perfectly fine (although a little boring).  Plus delivery was free with $30+ orders.  

I'll definitely be ordering from Takara again!

excerpts: Hotate (scallop), Maguro (tuna), Flying Fish roe, and Tako (octopus).
SO amazing delicious.
The scallop and tuna were our favorites-
the fish was super fresh and tasted perfect.
Also we ordered the fatty tuna w/green onion roll and the Volcano.
Order the Volcano - it's beautiful and well worth the $12.
We also got miso soup-
I wasn't a fan..
I had to ask twice for it
and when we got it, it was kinda watery and tasteless.
But my lady disagreed - she liked it.
Either way- the fish is what we came for and we were overall impressed.
Great service - we were seated immediately and given menus, drinks were fast, food was good.
Definitely a place worth checking out!
hotate.author: Ashley F.
hotate.review: Not bad! I'm picky when it comes to my sushi and Takara impressed me. My girlfriend and I got some nigiri- Hotate (scallop), Maguro (tuna), Flying Fish roe, and Tako (octopus). SO amazing delicious. The scallop and tuna were our favorites- the fish was super fresh and tasted perfect. Also we ordered the fatty tuna w/green onion roll and the Volcano. Order the Volcano - it's beautiful and well worth the $12. We also got miso soup- I wasn't a fan.. I had to ask twice for it and when we got it, it was kinda watery and tasteless. But my lady disagreed - she liked it. Either way- the fish is what we came for and we were overall impressed. Great service - we were seated immediately and given menus, drinks were fast, food was good. Definitely a place worth checking out! :)

excerpts:
Nigiri for $1.80/pc off the happy hour menu $3 big sapporo (DO NOT pass on the shiro maguro)
Dinner for two with drinks can run you $35 and that's if you over order.
The quality of the fish is not degraded by the fact it's a happy hour menu.
But be warned, 6pm is the cut off for happy hour.

No wiggle room 
Sit at the bar and enjoy.

Dinner for two with drinks can run you $35 and that's if you over order.
The quality of the fish is not degraded by the fact it's a happy hour menu.
But be warned, 6pm is the cut off for happy hour.

No wiggle room 
Sit at the bar and enjoy.
shiro maguro.author: Bob H.
shiro maguro.review:
Check out the happy hour menu. 
Nigiri for $1.80/pc off the happy hour menu $3 big sapporo (DO NOT pass on the shiro maguro)
Dinner for two with drinks can run you $35 and that's if you over order. 
The quality of the fish is not degraded by the fact it's a happy hour menu. 
But be warned, 6pm is the cut off for happy hour. No wiggle room 
Sit at the bar and enjoy.

excerpts: My favorite thing we ordered was the Tai Carpaccio.
I think that I could eat that everyday.
Great balance of flavors and attention to detail on every plate.
I already want to come back to try everything else before we go back to Oregon!
tai.author: Stacy M.
tai.review:
Exellent sushi experience! We loved every single thing we ordered. Great service, very chill  ambience. Numerous menu offerings and specials. I like that they tell you where the fish is from. My favorite thing we ordered was the Tai Carpaccio. I think that I could eat that everyday. Great balance of flavors and attention to detail on every plate. 
I already want to come back to try everything else before we go back to Oregon!

excerpts: sashimi is super fresh there, my tai literally melted in my mouth.
tai.author: Michie Y.
tai.review:
sashimi is super fresh there, my tai literally melted in my mouth. all others that i tried (uni, amaebi, salmon) were also very good (in taste and display). volcano roll and their seasoned edamame made the best appetizers. prices are reasonable for the quality, every penny worth! the owner and the people working at the sushi bar are also very friendly. 

this place is really for people that enjoy sushi. while there are many options where i can pay less for so-so rolls that can stuff my stomach, i would always come back for sushi.   

i think this place is even better than sushi ota in sd.

excerpts: The chef's sashimi came with 3 slices each of 6 types of fish (tuna, salmon, scallop, walu, squid (?), and hamachi).
walu.author: Abby S.
walu.review:
Food (4/5): I shared the snow roll and the chef's sashimi with a friend. Snow roll has tempura shrimp and unagi inside, and crab, tobiko, and unagi sauce on the outside. Great combination of textures and flavors! The roll was pretty big, too.

 The chef's sashimi came with 3 slices each of 6 types of fish (tuna, salmon, scallop, walu, squid (?), and hamachi). Tasted pretty fresh, but the slices were really small.

Our other friend got the tempura udon, which came with a sizable portion of shrimp and veggie tempura. His food looked really good - I wished I ordered that! 

Service (5/5): Free edamame! Portions are really tiny though and no refills. We called in fifteen minutes before arriving and they were nice enough to hold a table for us. Servers were attentive and took care of us!

Value (4/5): Udon at ~$11 is prob the most value on the menu, but rolls ($6-14) aren't bad either. The chef's sashimi was $35 for 18 smallish pieces, which is okay too.

excerpts: Ikura sushi was half the normal size.
ikura.author: Sue R.
ikura.review: Delivery was 30 minutes late. Tempura was cold and soggy. Ikura sushi was half the normal size.

excerpts: To accommodate Jamie's taste, we had the $5.95 King California Roll which contains real versus imitation crab, a worthwhile dollar surcharge for the real thing (photo: http://bit.ly/1xzGk7N).
Nothing really to say about the roll except that it was put together as expected and tasted fine for a California roll, I suppose.
I ordered the $12.95 X-Roll, an elaborate creation with yellowtail, avocado, tuna and salmon, drizzled with an aioli-like spicy sauce and topped with tobiko (photo: http://bit.ly/1s0bMM3).
It was a bit like a rainbow roll with mayo.
Not a bad thing if you ask me.
The last was the $14 O-Toro Nigiri, fatty tuna wrapped around rice with tiny shrimp in another sauce
(photo: http://bit.ly/1xzGqfP).
That was quite good
but I was finding it hard to justify the price in my head, just my belly.
king california roll.author: Ed U.
king california roll.review:
Even though I had a passing curiosity about its previous identity as an intimate Asian fusion restaurant, I never made it here when Sumi ran this spot. It looked attractive, but I heard mixed notices about the food. When she retired six years ago, it completely fell off my radar, and when it changed names, it might as well have entered the witness protection program. Then one night, I was at Curry Boyz right across the street and glanced over. Suddenly it looked inviting to me. It only took ten years. Par for the course for me. Anyway, Jamie W. and I finally made it here after checking out the new rainbow crosswalks at 18th and Castro.

They just opened for the evening, so they were just setting up for dinner. Naming the place Takara didn't help me remember me since it's a pretty common Japanese name. There's even a restaurant in J-Town with the same name. It's kinda like naming a place Sam's. Anyhow, it's mainly sushi though they have standard Japanese fare if you prefer something that's been near a stove. Our meal began with a $5.95 plate of Gyoza which were pretty well grilled and provided a satisfying start (photo: http://bit.ly/1xyaZmn). We segued into a $4.95 plate of Grilled Eggplant slices sprinkled with chopped scallions and accompanied by a ponzu dipping sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/1tL62XB).

Good, not mushy though a tad lukewarm. The sight of Ankimo on a menu always makes me excited like a little girl wearing her first training bra. So for $8.50, a plateful was in order, and it was just as fresh a piece of monkfish liver as I could hope for, nicely sliced and also accompanied by ponzu sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/1IjkSpm). That was gone so quickly I'm surprised Jamie still has fingers. Then our main sushi order arrived on one plate. To accommodate Jamie's taste, we had the $5.95 King California Roll which contains real versus imitation crab, a worthwhile dollar surcharge for the real thing (photo: http://bit.ly/1xzGk7N).

Nothing really to say about the roll except that it was put together as expected and tasted fine for a California roll, I suppose. I ordered the $12.95 X-Roll, an elaborate creation with yellowtail, avocado, tuna and salmon, drizzled with an aioli-like spicy sauce and topped with tobiko (photo: http://bit.ly/1s0bMM3). It was a bit like a rainbow roll with mayo. Not a bad thing if you ask me. The last was the $14 O-Toro Nigiri, fatty tuna wrapped around rice with tiny shrimp in another sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/1xzGqfP). That was quite good but I was finding it hard to justify the price in my head, just my belly. They do sushi well here, and it's well worth a try if you're in the mood.

FOOD - 4 stars...sushi well executed...and they have ankimo...score!
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...tiny spot crowds easily so come earlier to avoid claustrophobia
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...attentive enough but a bit aloof
TOTAL - 4 stars...probably your best sushi option in the Castro

excerpts:
King California Roll - good
Dragon Roll - decent
king california roll.author: Dennis K.
king california roll.review:
well well well Takara, i ate in person once and i ordered 6 times via eat24 and the last two were bad.

i didn't complain about my 5th order but today the 6th draws the line. They have been getting progressively worse and people should know.

we ordered
Tokyo breeze - had old avocado, tuna was not too good on it
old avocado here http://imgur.com/QpYMnUh
King California Roll - good
Dragon Roll - decent
Salmon lover - yuck fish tasted odd and we did not finish

i dont understand why take out customers get crappy food. 

Don't order take out from here they won't give you good food, probably saved it for the restaurant.

excerpts: We ordered a King California roll, two spider hand rolls, a spicy tuna hand roll, two bowls of miso, and two glasses of water.
The crab in the King California roll had a strange texture and didn't taste that great.
The crab in the King California roll had a strange texture and didn't taste that great.
The spicy tuna hand roll came 10 minutes after the first part of the meal.
We thought they forgot it, and when it came it had too much batter to actually taste anything.
king california roll.author: Brian S.
king california roll.review:
I had higher hopes for this place, but you can tell they are just opening up.  I hope they figure things out because the staff seemed like very nice people. 

The evening started with the host confused about where we should sit.  After looking at his watch and glancing at his supervisor, he moved us to the other side of the restaurant; no big.  

We ordered a King California roll, two spider hand rolls, a spicy tuna hand roll, two bowls of miso, and two glasses of water.  The crab in the King California roll had a strange texture and didn't taste that great.  The spicy tuna hand roll came 10 minutes after the first part of the meal.  We thought they forgot it, and when it came it had too much batter to actually taste anything.  The spicy tuna roll was ok.  The miso was good.  Finally, the water never came :(. 

The overall experience was awkward at best.  The interior of the restaurant is nice, through it seemed a bit too rigid.  The wait staff seemed to have no clue what was going on.  After the lead wait staff person asked how our evening went, I explained the issues.  If anything, I hope they can improve.  It has the potential to be a cool place to eat, but they need to improve some things.  I ended up eatting only one of the pieces of sushi and a bit of the spider roll to taste it;  I am still hungry.  Two stars for now, but I will try again in a couple of months if the restaurant lasts. 

The positives: free green tea (yummie), free edamame (it was warm but good), and the bathroom was very clean.  

The best part is the host delivered our check with a quiet "I am so sorry."  

Best of luck to your new business.

excerpts: +Negi hamachi maki roll:
Yellowtail with grreen onion.
A small portion, but just how I like it.
negi hamachi maki.author: Adena B.
negi hamachi maki.review:
Walked in with the boyfriend on a random weekday for dinner. We were greeted and seated immediately.

Water glasses brought soon thereafter and orders taken quickly and efficiently. 

EATS
+Miso soup: Good, strong broth, not watered down; the right amount of seaweed, green onion, and tofu.
+Negi hamachi maki roll: Yellowtail with grreen onion. A small portion, but just how I like it.
+Unagi donburi: grilled freshwater eel over rice with unagi sauce. Tasty and filling: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/takara-sushi-san-francisco?select=IM15oB7zInJytQk2BfKRrg#IM15oB7zInJytQk2BfKRrg

All in all, a pleasant experience with good food and fair prices. Not bad for a sushi joint in the Castro.

excerpts: Miso Soup, and my choice of two maki (Hamachi Nega Maki, Spicy Tuna Roll), brought out well crafted fare that was light, fresh, and satisfying.
spicy tuna roll.author: Tracey A.
spicy tuna roll.review:
Hiding in plain sight, I've easily walked past Takara Sushi 150 times and finally just learned that they're open for lunch.  People are constantly asking me where to go for lunch in the Castro and now that I know that Takara serves it, I've added it to my list of suggestions.  

If you're in the Castro, seeking well-priced Japanese food for lunch, here's your place.

I understand that Takara does a bustling business at night which might account for the tired look of it during mid-day.  The tables were worn and the place looked bleak enough that I had a moment of hesitation on whether I really wanted to try their raw fish.  The moment passed, I overlooked the interior, ordered, and crossed my fingers.

Trust.  I was rewarded.

For around $10.50, the lunch menu offers a Bento box as well as a combination sushi lunch which I opted for.  Miso Soup, and my choice of two maki (Hamachi Nega Maki, Spicy Tuna Roll), brought out well crafted fare that was light, fresh, and satisfying.  A steaming cup of green tea reinvigorated me almost enough to step back out into a day of rain.

It's nothing fancy during the daytime but their offering is satisfying and I've no doubt I'll return.  Takara Sushi?  Nice to finally see you.

excerpts: Spicy Tuna Roll:
spicy tuna roll.author: Simon C.
spicy tuna roll.review:
Hmm... I have no idea why this place is rated with 4-star. After a delivery eating experience I would say 2-star is maximum.

So, I ordered delivery through doordash and the expected delivery time was 7:57pm. At 7:12pm restaurant confirmed the order and begun to prepare the food, and the food wasn't be able to pick up until 8:16pm and finally got our food at 8:24pm. Almost an 30-min delay. Okay let me assume it is not the restaurant's problem but rather the delivery service itself; but the food was mediocre.

Tonkatsu: C.
Okay, probably delivery of fried food was not a smart idea (foiled paper was used and a hole was cut at the lid preventing damping fried food with moisture), but it couldn't have been that bad? Very hard to chew. Moreover, some cheese was added in the middle of each piece of tonkatsu, the combination was super weird and it did not taste good at all.

Eggplant: B-.
It was some small pieces of eggplant topped with shrimp and scallop. Not sure the appropriate temperature but both the eggplant and seafood was cold. The eggplant barely had taste in it.

Spicy Tuna Roll: B.
Decent, spicy tuna was with okay freshness.

X-Roll: B-.
It's some salmon+tuna-topped roll with mayo. Fish freshness was average. The mayo did not do the job to enhance or add an interesting taste to the roll.

Hamachi Sushi: B+.
The hamachi was considered fresh. But the sushi as a whole was not impressive. Cold rice.

Salmon Sushi: B-.
The salmon was not fresh at all. Don't have much to say about it.

Portion of each dish was small. Yet it turned out to be ~$49+tax total. A very unsatisfying meal. Won't go back again, not delivery nor dine-in.

excerpts: Most noteworthy was the Fire Ball, which is basically pieces of spicy tuna roll rolled into a ball, deep fried and covered with spicy mayo and other delicious sauces.
Prices are very reasonable as well.
Recommend it if you're in the area and craving sushi!
spicy tuna roll.author: Christine G.
spicy tuna roll.review:
This is a great local sushi spot in the Castro.  Really good, fresh rolls here!  

The ambience is pretty no-frills in the way a lower price-range sushi spot often is, but you can't really go wrong with anything food-wise.  Most noteworthy was the Fire Ball, which is basically pieces of spicy tuna roll rolled into a ball, deep fried and covered with spicy mayo and other delicious sauces.  Prices are very reasonable as well.  Recommend it if you're in the area and craving sushi!

excerpts: I ordered the spicy tuna roll, red dragon roll, and miso soup.
The rolls were just okay.
The tuna didn't have much flavor.
The rice was cooked well however.
The price point for the sushi was pretty average for San Francisco standards.
I would give Takara another shot and try something different next time.
spicy tuna roll.author: Josh S.
spicy tuna roll.review: Takara has friendly and attentive staff in a comfortable and cool looking restaurant.  The inside has two levels - the floor has tables by the front windows and the raised level up the steps opens up to a larger dining area.  I ordered the spicy tuna roll, red dragon roll, and miso soup.  The rolls were just okay.  The tuna didn't have much flavor.  The rice was cooked well however.  The price point for the sushi was pretty average for San Francisco standards.  I would give Takara another shot and try something different next time.

excerpts: The spicy tuna roll was perfect.
I thought the ankimo was not as good as some places
but it was better than most.
spicy tuna roll.author: Ben M.
spicy tuna roll.review:
I walked in promptly for my 7:30 reservation and as I entered my glasses steamed over. The place was totally packed on a Thursday night. Tons of people were waiting and I'm glad we had the reservation. Seems my 5 year old was the only kid in this place at the time. I thought that was a bit surprising and I'm glad we had the front window seat. This helped my daughter out with a boring adult dinner situation as she could partake in some people watching.

I did notice that sitting next to the door kind of sucked. Way to much traffic and people crowding in to get a seat.I like that the place ifs seating for 35. It's large enough to keep a steady flow, but small enough to feel very personal.

All of the sushi tasted super fresh. We had the sashimi combo and a ton of rolls.
The spicy tuna roll was perfect. I thought the ankimo was not as good as some places but it was better than most.

excerpts: The spicy tuna roll was ok.
The miso was good.

excerpts: This party of one (my, myself & ...) drop in for a quick spicy tuna roll & a Sapporo before I head home to be domestic.
I ordered & waited.  ...
After about 5 minutes 2 guys sit at the table next to me & order a few rolls (including a spicy tuna roll).
I know this not because I'm an eavesdropping weirdo, but because the tables are close together.
(The rating has nothing to do with this, as it actually adds to the charm of the atmosphere of this small but cute establishment).
So, long story short
, my roll goes to the other guys.
It's written on my server's face that she knows this (and the fact that she is telling the chef to make a spicy tuna roll very quickly kind of gives it away too).
Nonetheless, instead of just coming over to explain what happened, she avoids me trying to buy time.
Eventually I became fed up with waiting more than 20 mins for a spicy tuna roll (especially as I was watching someone else eat my roll).
So, I canceled my roll, paid for the beer and bounced.
I'll give them one more chance down the road (everyone has an off day), but for now I just can't recommend.
spicy tuna roll.author: Doug V.
spicy tuna roll.review: First, let me acknowledge that it really pains me to post this one star review.  While you can't swing a dead cat around the Castro without hitting a crazy queer or two (don't be offended, I'm one myself), all the swinging pussy in the world won't hit a truly good sushi joint here.  Nevertheless, Takara was a welcome addition to the neighborhood since it's rolls make the competition look (and taste) like cat food.  However, after my experience tonight, I can post nothing else.  This party of one (my, myself & ...) drop in for a quick spicy tuna roll & a Sapporo before I head home to be domestic.  I ordered & waited.  ...  After about 5 minutes 2 guys sit at the table next to me & order a few rolls (including a spicy tuna roll).  I know this not because I'm an eavesdropping weirdo, but because the tables are close together.  (The rating has nothing to do with this, as it actually adds to the charm of the atmosphere of this small but cute establishment).  So, long story short, my roll goes to the other guys.  It's written on my server's face that she knows this (and the fact that she is telling the chef to make a spicy tuna roll very quickly kind of gives it away too).  Nonetheless, instead of just coming over to explain what happened, she avoids me trying to buy time.  Eventually I became fed up with waiting more than 20 mins for a spicy tuna roll (especially as I was watching someone else eat my roll).  So, I canceled my roll, paid for the beer and bounced. I'll give them one more chance down the road (everyone has an off day), but for now I just can't recommend.

excerpts: A couple of cons though--the edamame wasn't good (at least for takeout), it was dry, shriveled, and saltless; the wasabi didn't have any heat; and finally, the spicy scallop roll had very little scallop in it (more cucumber than anything).
Cons aside, this will be my new go-to for in-home sushi
b/c
the quality of the fish is better than others nearby and I would anticipate that the edamame is better if you are eating it live in the restaurant.
spicy scallop roll.author: R S.
spicy scallop roll.review: Reviewing takeout order: Finally tried a new local take out place b/c the ones that do takeout or delivery near Noe Valley have been disappointing and underwhelming at best. I was really happy that the fish tasted very fresh and there were a lot of options. I will definitely order pick up from here again. A couple of cons though--the edamame wasn't good (at least for takeout), it was dry, shriveled, and saltless; the wasabi didn't have any heat; and finally, the spicy scallop roll had very little scallop in it (more cucumber than anything). Cons aside, this will be my new go-to for in-home sushi b/c the quality of the fish is better than others nearby and I would anticipate that the edamame is better if you are eating it live in the restaurant.

excerpts: we ordered a spicy scallop roll and the scallop portion was quite small you almost couldnt taste it.
The service is super friendly and super duper speedy though!
spicy scallop roll.author: Ryan S.
spicy scallop roll.review: The sushi here is always really fresh. The only downfall is some of the rolls could use a little more fish inside. we ordered a spicy scallop roll and the scallop portion was quite small you almost couldnt taste it. The service is super friendly and super duper speedy though!

excerpts: The tempura roll was on par and really crispy on the inside.
The Chirashi bowl was simple and satisfying.
A great place for authentic Japanese food and atmosphere.
tempura roll.author: Elaine Y.
tempura roll.review:
Nice restaurant which really felt authentic due all the Japanese customers there.  Situated at the back, next to Miyako hotel, a quiet area away from the hustle and bustle of the mall. I had moments when I felt I was in Japan and we were the only non Japanese customers there.  The waitress was super hospitable. The food was good....the miso ramen was simple and a little on the salty side for me.  The tempura roll was on par and really crispy on the inside. The Chirashi bowl was simple and satisfying.
A great place for authentic Japanese food and atmosphere.

excerpts: (got the avocado maki and sweet potato tempura roll).
The fish dishes looked amazing and seemed super inventive.
They were also huge!
I will definitely come back.
tempura roll.author: Karen D.
tempura roll.review: I don't eat fish so I may not be the best person to review a sushi place- but the veggie fish options were super good (got the avocado maki and sweet potato tempura roll). The fish dishes looked amazing and seemed super inventive. They were also huge! I will definitely come back.

excerpts: We also got a California roll, tempura roll and goyza.
tempura roll.author: John S.
tempura roll.review:
I got take out from Takara last weekend and was very happy overall with this small sushi restaurant in my new neighborhood.  

We ordered the volcano roll which I really enjoyed.  We also got a California roll, tempura roll and goyza.  Everything tasted good and was definitely fresh, we especially enjoyed the rolls with tempura.  

The staff was very nice.  The only downside was we had to wait 15 minutes for our order once we arrived to pick it up and the restaurant was cramped with no where to stand.

excerpts: Veggie Tempura Roll wrapped in soy-paper:
tempura roll.author: Alex M.
tempura roll.review:
From the second I walked in, everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful. I ordered all vegetarian dishes to go. While I waited they brought me green tea (on the house) and the woman informed me that they can make custom veggie rolls!

Ohitashi: very fresh and flavorful
Cucumber Sunomono: it tasted as good as it looked!
Veggie Tempura Roll wrapped in soy-paper: My new favorite roll!

Everything was packaged very carefully.

This is a great neighborhood spot I will return to over and over again. I am excited to learn they deliver as well.
