I ordered the $12.95 X-Roll, an elaborate creation with yellowtail, avocado, tuna and salmon, drizzled with an aioli-like spicy sauce and topped with tobiko (photo: http://bit.ly/1s0bMM3). It was a bit like a rainbow roll with mayo. Not a bad thing if you ask me. The last was the $14 O-Toro Nigiri, fatty tuna wrapped around rice with tiny shrimp in another sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/1xzGqfP). That was quite good but I was finding it hard to justify the price in my head, just my belly. They do sushi well here, and it's well worth a try if you're in the mood.

FOOD - 4 stars...sushi well executed...and they have ankimo...score!
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...tiny spot crowds easily so come earlier to avoid claustrophobia
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...attentive enough but a bit aloof
TOTAL - 4 stars...probably your best sushi option in the Castro

excerpts: Same typical dishes on the menu, same boring taste of every other California roll you've had dozens of times before...basically uninspiring.
california roll.author: Destini M.
california roll.review:
This place isn't bad...but I probably wouldn't return. The prices are reasonable...and rightly so as the sushi tastes like anything I could pick up at a local market.

The problems with Takara is the way it's so painfully...ordinary. There's literally nothing about it that makes you want to go running back after you're done. Same typical dishes on the menu, same boring taste of every other California roll you've had dozens of times before...basically uninspiring. 

If you're looking for affordable sushi that you also won't remember soon after... this is the place for you!

excerpts: We also got a California roll, tempura roll and goyza.
california roll.author: John S.
california roll.review:
I got take out from Takara last weekend and was very happy overall with this small sushi restaurant in my new neighborhood.  

We ordered the volcano roll which I really enjoyed.  We also got a California roll, tempura roll and goyza.  Everything tasted good and was definitely fresh, we especially enjoyed the rolls with tempura.  

The staff was very nice.  The only downside was we had to wait 15 minutes for our order once we arrived to pick it up and the restaurant was cramped with no where to stand.

excerpts:
King California Roll - good
Dragon Roll - decent
california roll.author: Dennis K.
california roll.review:
well well well Takara, i ate in person once and i ordered 6 times via eat24 and the last two were bad.

i didn't complain about my 5th order but today the 6th draws the line. They have been getting progressively worse and people should know.

we ordered
Tokyo breeze - had old avocado, tuna was not too good on it
old avocado here http://imgur.com/QpYMnUh
King California Roll - good
Dragon Roll - decent
Salmon lover - yuck fish tasted odd and we did not finish

i dont understand why take out customers get crappy food. 

Don't order take out from here they won't give you good food, probably saved it for the restaurant.

excerpts: I asked to substitute a simple cucumber only roll in place of the California roll and was swiftly denied saying it was preset.
This makes me suspicious that the bento boxes are premade.
Or at least the components are.
Other than that the price was very cheap for a large amount of food.
Would return just because of price..
They also play very loud electronic music in the dining room.
california roll.author: Rae T.
california roll.review: No substitutions in the bento boxes. I asked to substitute a simple cucumber only roll in place of the California roll and was swiftly denied saying it was preset. This makes me suspicious that the bento boxes are premade. Or at least the components are. Other than that the price was very cheap for a large amount of food. Would return just because of price.. They also play very loud electronic music in the dining room.

excerpts: got me (and my girlie friend) some baked mussels---garlic-y and cheesy, tempura udon--comforting!, tokyo breeze--light and breezy sushi, REAL california roll---which had a REAL crab.
california roll.author: Marc K.
california roll.review:
one of the last and few restaurants that i haven't tried around the castro area. definitely, a place to try and get your japanese fix on!

first, the place is so small and pretty intimiate, i should say. nice restroom, may i say? you can always tell a place on what kind of restroom they have. just sayin.

2nd, the food wasn't disappointing, at all! got me (and my girlie friend) some baked mussels---garlic-y and cheesy, tempura udon--comforting!, tokyo breeze--light and breezy sushi, REAL california roll---which had a REAL crab. overall, it was such a comforting dinner on a cold, SF night.

3rd, my girlie friend was happy enough to say that..they were playing authentic japanese pop music. AWESOMENESS! 

a worthwhile to visit all over over over.....A G A I N! ^_^

excerpts: After placing our order at 8:10pm for 2 ppl, we received one california roll at 8:30 and the remaining 4 rolls more than 15 mins later after complaining to the waitress.
california roll.author: J. R.
california roll.review:
Long Long LONG wait for *RAW* sushi. After placing our order at 8:10pm for 2 ppl, we received one california roll at 8:30 and the remaining 4 rolls more than 15 mins later after complaining to the waitress. My partner had to ask for a complimentary bowl of miso soup (otherwise $3). Needless to say, we missed the July 4th fireworks show.

Would I eat here again? Absolutely not. Especially not when you're in a rush.

Water refills are very timely though.

excerpts: We ordered a King California roll, two spider hand rolls, a spicy tuna hand roll, two bowls of miso, and two glasses of water.
The crab in the King California roll had a strange texture and didn't taste that great.
The crab in the King California roll had a strange texture and didn't taste that great.
The spicy tuna hand roll came 10 minutes after the first part of the meal.
We thought they forgot it, and when it came it had too much batter to actually taste anything.
california roll.author: Brian S.
california roll.review:
I had higher hopes for this place, but you can tell they are just opening up.  I hope they figure things out because the staff seemed like very nice people. 

The evening started with the host confused about where we should sit.  After looking at his watch and glancing at his supervisor, he moved us to the other side of the restaurant; no big.  

We ordered a King California roll, two spider hand rolls, a spicy tuna hand roll, two bowls of miso, and two glasses of water.  The crab in the King California roll had a strange texture and didn't taste that great.  The spicy tuna hand roll came 10 minutes after the first part of the meal.  We thought they forgot it, and when it came it had too much batter to actually taste anything.  The spicy tuna roll was ok.  The miso was good.  Finally, the water never came :(. 

The overall experience was awkward at best.  The interior of the restaurant is nice, through it seemed a bit too rigid.  The wait staff seemed to have no clue what was going on.  After the lead wait staff person asked how our evening went, I explained the issues.  If anything, I hope they can improve.  It has the potential to be a cool place to eat, but they need to improve some things.  I ended up eatting only one of the pieces of sushi and a bit of the spider roll to taste it;  I am still hungry.  Two stars for now, but I will try again in a couple of months if the restaurant lasts. 

The positives: free green tea (yummie), free edamame (it was warm but good), and the bathroom was very clean.  

The best part is the host delivered our check with a quiet "I am so sorry."  

Best of luck to your new business.

excerpts: The sushi had no taste, the crab in the California roll tasted off, overall a waste of money.
california roll.author: J Z.
california roll.review: The sushi had no taste, the crab in the California roll tasted off, overall a waste of money. Even the edamame were undercooked and inedible. I'm giving them two two stars only because after calling to complain they refunded the money which was very reasonable of them.

excerpts: I ordered a california hand roll and another roll
i can't remember the name of.
Everything tasted adequate, but our table required a 2nd round of orders too get full.
california hand roll.author: Jon C.
california hand roll.review:
So so...

I enjoyed walking in to this quaint little spot. I'd love to give them a higher rating. But it just wasn't filling enough. Portions are on the smaller side, and prices are on the steeper side. Not an ideal combo.

I ordered a california hand roll and another roll i can't remember the name of. Everything tasted adequate, but our table required a 2nd round of orders too get full. $90 later, we were done. 

While I enjoyed everything, it didn't blow me away for how much I had to pay.

excerpts:
Sometimes the soft shell crab is prepared better than others, but overall a solid roll.
- Spicy Tuna Hand Roll (5 stars): Good tuna with a perfect amount of spiciness.
- Eggplant Special (5 stars): Super delicious combo of scallop/eggplant/shrimp! 
Spicy miso sauce gives each bite a nice kick.
spicy tuna hand roll.author: Jennifer L.
spicy tuna hand roll.review:
Yummy neighborhood sushi joint 2 blocks away from me, what more could I ask for! I've eaten here about 4x now, and I've enjoyed every meal! 

Sashimi is always fresh, and they have a pretty good selection of food options to choose from. Here are some of the items I've had:
- Volcano Roll (5 stars): Eel/mango/tuna/salmon with some crispy flakes. Yum! Doesn't look like a traditional roll, but under all the crispy flakes, you'll find the delicious pieces of sushi, don't worry.
- Summer Roll (3.5 stars): A bit plain, but I like it when I'm trying to go for something simple and lighter since it's wrapped with soy paper and doesn't have any extravagant sauces on it.
- Dinosaur Roll (4 stars): Soft-shell crab goodness! Sometimes the soft shell crab is prepared better than others, but overall a solid roll.
- Spicy Tuna Hand Roll (5 stars): Good tuna with a perfect amount of spiciness.
- Eggplant Special (5 stars): Super delicious combo of scallop/eggplant/shrimp! Spicy miso sauce gives each bite a nice kick.
- Tempura Udon (2 stars): I got this via delivery since I was craving noodles so might not be a right indicator of the actual dish. But it didn't taste like anything special, and I would've liked a better assortment of tempura.
- Salmon sashimi appetizer (4 stars): Very smooth, but I usually let the bf eat all of this since it's his fave type of sashimi.

Additional pluses: I've never had to wait for a seat, and the prices are decent (prob can get out of here paying between $15-20/person). The restaurant provides free edamame beans before your meal (love it because I always feel cheated when places try to sell me a tiny plate of edamame for $5), and the waiters are super attentive in refilling tea. Seriously, I don't think my tea cup has ever gone empty... they definitely have some magic tea radar up in here.

excerpts: We ordered a King California roll, two spider hand rolls, a spicy tuna hand roll, two bowls of miso, and two glasses of water.
The crab in the King California roll had a strange texture and didn't taste that great.
The crab in the King California roll had a strange texture and didn't taste that great.
The spicy tuna hand roll came 10 minutes after the first part of the meal.
We thought they forgot it, and when it came it had too much batter to actually taste anything.

excerpts: We ordered gyoza, a tempura hand roll, shrimp sashimi and a few other items.
The gyoza tasted like it sat in the fridge, the tempura in the hand roll was stale, and for shrimp sashimi we receive shrimp nigiri.
They were dismissive when we called to let them know!
Really?!?!
Who does that?
We've eaten at all of their restaurants in the city and their food quality and poor service appear to be problematic at all of their locations.
Another restaurant to cross off our list.
I'm sad.
tempura hand roll.author: Denny L.
tempura hand roll.review:
I'm sad! What happened?!?! Tonight's food was horrible! 
We live less than a mile away and our food delivery arrived long after an hour had gone by. We ordered gyoza, a tempura hand roll, shrimp sashimi and a few other items. The gyoza tasted like it sat in the fridge, the tempura in the hand roll was stale, and for shrimp sashimi we receive shrimp nigiri. They were dismissive when we called to let them know! Really?!?! Who does that? 
We've eaten at all of their restaurants in the city and their food quality and poor service appear to be problematic at all of their locations. 
Another restaurant to cross off our list. I'm sad.

excerpts: I got miso soup with clams, which was tasty, followed by Takara special and salmon skin hand roll.
I really liked all of it.
Yes, this girl can eat a lot!!!
Don't judge, don't judge...
salmon skin hand roll.author: Marina S.
salmon skin hand roll.review:
Love this place!!!  I live about a block away and have walked by many times. For some reason I was hesitant to try it. It can't be that good if it's so convenient, right??? Same premise as if it's too good to be true, it probably is. Wrong!!!  

The service is fast and friendly, the sushi is fresh and yummy, the presentation is creative, and the ambiance is cute. I keep seeing the sushi chef put out one gorgeous roll after another and I want to try them all!!!  My sake sashimi basically melted in my mouth. I got miso soup with clams, which was tasty, followed by Takara special and salmon skin hand roll. I really liked all of it.  Yes, this girl can eat a lot!!!  Don't judge, don't judge...I know where the gym is ;-). 

While it is still not my favorite sushi place in the City, I must say that I will make this my favorite neighborhood sushi joint. Can't wait to return!!!

excerpts: My friend got the chicken teriyaki dinner plate.
It was very meh.
chicken teriyaki.author: Christina L.
chicken teriyaki.review:
Why is there such huge rating inflations for Asian food in the Castro? It's so terrible. Mama Ji's is overpriced and bad, and this place is no different.

I got the Tokyo Breeze, which had pretty good reviews on Yelp. It had avocado and lemon with tuna on top. They also season the roll with sesame oil and salt, which I thought was interesting. It tasted really weird though. The tuna was fresh, but the lemon just completely threw off the taste of the roll. It was incredibly sour. My friend had a bite of mine and made a weird face. It's very unexpectedly sour so beware. 

My friend got the chicken teriyaki dinner plate. It was very meh. Just a ton of chicken with rice and a side salad and miso soup. No cooked veggies or any kind of garnish.

We also got beer-- they have Asahi Black!!! If you've never tried it before, you have to get it. They poured it into this long fancy cup which looked nice. When we were done, we each asked for another one, and the waitress only came out with one beer
and strangely, she poured half into each of our cups and walked away before we could ask for another one... This was super weird. It's as if she was trying to restrict our alcohol consumption or something lol. We definitely made it really clear that we each wanted another beer... why would we want to share one???! On top of that, she immediately came out with the check which made us uncomfortable since we just got our drinks and wanted to enjoy it. And then 5 minutes later (we hadn't paid yet), she came back to our table and was like oops sorry and took the check away and then brought it back a couple of minutes later. I assume she forgot to add the beer in there or something.

Anyway, this was a super weird experience and a pretty mediocre meal. Only reason I'm giving it 2 stars instead of one is because they have Asahi Black.

excerpts: King CA roll with real crab was good, but the chicken teriyaki was drowning in bland, watery sauce and sesame seed.
chicken teriyaki.author: Jerico P.
chicken teriyaki.review:
Food: King CA roll with real crab was good, but the chicken teriyaki was drowning in bland, watery sauce and sesame seed.

Staff:  Friendly, but I'm not sure if they're Japanese.

Environment:  Small space and loud.

excerpts: The beef teriyaki is super yummy, the sauce is so good and the beef has great flavor.
Overall this is a great restaurant!
beef teriyaki.author: Natalye P.
beef teriyaki.review: The food is very good here! The sushi is fresh and the service is friendly and attentive. The beef teriyaki is super yummy, the sauce is so good and the beef has great flavor. Overall this is a great restaurant!

excerpts: Pricey sushi for okay quality and beef teriyaki is dry and it taste like store bought sauce.
The quality of the fish is similar to the groceries where they sell sashimi or even worse.
Nothing special about this place
and I think the live sushi on Taraval is better quality than this place
and it's cheaper there.
I only go here when I'm around castro
and I'm craving for Japanese food.
beef teriyaki.author: Toni Rose M.
beef teriyaki.review: Pricey sushi for okay quality and beef teriyaki is dry and it taste like store bought sauce. The quality of the fish is similar to the groceries where they sell sashimi or even worse.  Nothing special about this place and I think the live sushi on Taraval is better quality than this place and it's cheaper there. I only go here when I'm around castro and I'm craving for Japanese food.

excerpts: When she came out with the food 10 minutes later, it was clear that the salmon teriyaki and saba shioyaki were reheated, and they didn't even touch to the cold tonkatsu.
Why bother asking if you're not going to do what is requested?
I was so mad I told my friend
I wasn't going to eat the cold tonkatsu.
The server overheard me saying this and asked if I wanted it reheated.
Why didn't you just remake the entire thing the first time I sent it back?
If i'm sending food back a second time, there's no way I'm going to eat it anymore.
salmon teriyaki.author: Joanie W.
salmon teriyaki.review:
1 star, never going back. 

First, when we ordered 2 salmon tasting plates, the server said the sushi chef would cut to accommodate 5 people, they didn't. She offered to bring it back, but it was fine. Didn't realize this would be indicative of the entire meal.

For our main meal, a friend and I both ordered bento boxes with cooked food. These came out 40 minutes after we ordered, and everything was cold. Our friends ordered sushi, so I bet they just timed the food wrong and let it sit in the kitchen. 

When I let our server know the food was cold, she asked us if we wanted to reheat or remake the food. We said remake. When she came out with the food 10 minutes later, it was clear that the salmon teriyaki and saba shioyaki were reheated, and they didn't even touch to the cold tonkatsu. Why bother asking if you're not going to do what is requested? I was so mad I told my friend I wasn't going to eat the cold tonkatsu. The server overheard me saying this and asked if I wanted it reheated. Why didn't you just remake the entire thing the first time I sent it back? If i'm sending food back a second time, there's no way I'm going to eat it anymore. I told her no thanks because I was starving.

At that point, I guess she felt bad (or that her tip was in jeopardy) so the kitchen sent us two fresh tonkatsus "on the house". Too little too late - 1) why didn't you just do this the first time the food was sent back!?!? and 2) the only reason they gave it to us "on the house" (oh thank you for your generosity) was because the server felt bad the second time, not even the first time. Kudos for feeling bad, but seriously, I've never been to a restaurant who tried so little to make up for a bad experience.

The owners/chef/server/whoever clearly didn't care about doing it right the first time, so this place clearly seems to me not to care much about the customer. It doesn't cost much to remake two portions in the grand scheme of things - I was a server for a long time before and during college, and I would have never treated my guests like that. I'm not asking for much, but just to have things given as ordered. I just hate that I felt like a second chance wasn't enough, but that I had to give a third and a fourth. Lucky them my friend was still nice enough to tip 15%. I'm not stingy, but people don't typically tip under 15, and if they do, it's because something needs to be seriously reconsidered and made better, whether that's food, service quality or both.

excerpts: I got a bento box with 2 items; salmon shioyaki and tempura.
It was good but nothing spectacular.
salmon shioyaki.author: Christina C.
salmon shioyaki.review:
I've only been here once during lunch and they were closing in an hour. Two of my friends and I ordered from the lunch menu and the price is decent for a Japanese restaurant but I have to say that the portions are a bit on the smaller side. I got a bento box with 2 items; salmon shioyaki and tempura. It was good but nothing spectacular. My tempura came with a small slice of eggplant, small slice of zucchini, a piece of broccoli, a slice of sweet potato (I think), and one tempura shrimp including a small salad, rice, and miso soup. 

However, one of my friends ordered their tempura udon and that looked so good! I was immediately regretful of my decision and wished I had ordered that! She said it was very delicious and would recommend so my guess is that you would probably get more of a bang for your buck ordering the udon. 

The waiter was very kind and helpful though! I think I would try this place again for the udon but probably wouldn't go out of my way for it.

excerpts: But, the chicken Katsu was good, as was the way the tempura was prepared (not too much batter).
Cal rolls had a good amount of crab meat and less of the rice (nice).
Although, the teriyaki beef was a bit on the chewy side.
Service was great, and the dining space was clean and inviting.
chicken katsu.author: Greg S.
chicken katsu.review:
Small restaurant two blocks off the Castro, this is a nice little place to get some good Japanese food. I'm not a sushi fan, so I won't comment on the sushi quality. But, the chicken Katsu was good, as was the way the tempura was prepared (not too much batter). Cal rolls had a good amount of crab meat and less of the rice (nice). Although, the teriyaki beef was a bit on the chewy side.
Service was great, and the dining space was clean and inviting.

excerpts: , Heads Will Roll, chicken katsu, and all the nigiri is awesome.
chicken katsu.author: Jason D.
chicken katsu.review:
One of my favorite sushi spots.  Great service, chill atmosphere, super fresh fish.  I've been there a lot, it helps because it's close to my house, but there are 3 other sushi spots close and they don't compare to Takara.
My picks are the Japonese Roll, Heads Will Roll, chicken katsu, and all the nigiri is awesome.

excerpts: The california rolls were definitely plan, the chicken katsu only tasted good because of the sauce and the small itsy bitsy salad was meh.
chicken katsu.author: Matthew H.
chicken katsu.review:
Had a to-go order with 4 friends that we picked up. Can't say that all of us were impressed. The to-go orders seemed to be lacking food... For as much as we paid, we had hoped we'd get fairly good portions - that wasn't the case.

The california rolls were definitely plan, the chicken katsu only tasted good because of the sauce and the small itsy bitsy salad was meh.

I hope they give a little more thought to to-go orders in the future.

excerpts: +Unagi donburi: grilled freshwater eel over rice with unagi sauce.
unagi donburi.author: Adena B.
unagi donburi.review:
Walked in with the boyfriend on a random weekday for dinner. We were greeted and seated immediately.

Water glasses brought soon thereafter and orders taken quickly and efficiently. 

EATS
+Miso soup: Good, strong broth, not watered down; the right amount of seaweed, green onion, and tofu.
+Negi hamachi maki roll: Yellowtail with grreen onion. A small portion, but just how I like it.
+Unagi donburi: grilled freshwater eel over rice with unagi sauce. Tasty and filling: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/takara-sushi-san-francisco?select=IM15oB7zInJytQk2BfKRrg#IM15oB7zInJytQk2BfKRrg

All in all, a pleasant experience with good food and fair prices. Not bad for a sushi joint in the Castro.

excerpts: We came here for my mom's annual bday unagi donburi dinner, and my mom's hell bent on trying to find her ultimate unagi donburi experience in San Francisco.
I had hoped this year unlike the other 2 years, we'd hit gold at Takara's, but, nope, it's strike three :( .
At $18 a bowl, you'd think my mom would have at least liked something about the dish, but she disliked everything about it.

She said the rice wasn't the short grain sushi type rice, and she got the tail end of the unagi with lots of bones and burnt bits on the edges, and not enough unagi sauce flavoring throughout the dish.
unagi donburi.author: Pauline L.
unagi donburi.review:
We came here for my mom's annual bday unagi donburi dinner, and my mom's hell bent on trying to find her ultimate unagi donburi experience in San Francisco. I had hoped this year unlike the other 2 years, we'd hit gold at Takara's, but, nope, it's strike three :( . At $18 a bowl, you'd think my mom would have at least liked something about the dish, but she disliked everything about it. She said the rice wasn't the short grain sushi type rice, and she got the tail end of the unagi with lots of bones and burnt bits on the edges, and not enough unagi sauce flavoring throughout the dish. Sigh...this pretty much sucks.

My caterpillar sushi roll on the other hand was tasty. I like how they use the bigger tobiko eggs instead of the tiny ones. I would have liked more unagi sauce drizzled on the bottom. It was rather skimpy, kinda like their unagi portions in it too. The good part is the fresh avocado on top. Very nice.

Jolene L. ordered 2 Aloha rolls specials...her favorite by far. It had sashimi tuna poke, and that's as much as ingredients I can remember...we also ordered the green tea ice cream served in a giant martini glass. I usually like green tea, but I thought it had a weird aftertaste finish, like eating a mouthful of lavender flowers. Yuck. At least my mom and Jolene L. ate it all. 

The wait staff was efficient, friendly and helpful which earns the extra star. They consistently gave great water and tea service. Parking is metered streets.

I am now in my mom's black list books... I can't go through another year giving her meh to blah unagi rice bowls for her birthday, I mean, what does it say when she'd rather eat unagi out of a tin can!?

excerpts: we also ordered hamachi kama which was huge!  and also the miso seabass that came with 3 or 4? pieces!
miso seabass.author: claudia y.
miso seabass.review:
we did a mini pre-bday celebration here with another couple and was presently suprised at the food.  this place is run by chinese people but the food is good.  i want to come back and try more of the nigiri and sashimi.  

we had some rolls:  crazy, salmon lover, and another one i cant remember the name of.  all of them were good!  we also ordered hamachi kama which was huge!  and also the miso seabass that came with 3 or 4? pieces! it was a lot of food.

i thought service was excellent as they kept coming by to check up and refill our teas and water.

parking in this neighborhood can be difficult though

excerpts:
Chicken udon ( $ 10.95) ) was good and filling.
Salmon rolls were fresh and tasty.
Overall good food.
chicken udon.author: Dani O.
chicken udon.review:
Good Sushi.
Takara special ( $26) was excellent.
Chicken udon ( $ 10.95) ) was good and filling.
Salmon rolls were fresh and tasty.
Overall good food.

excerpts: Then we had the kamikaze roll, x roll, salmon sashimi, and chicken udon.
The kamikaze roll was very good.
I'm a big spicy tuna fan to begin with though!
The x roll was also delicious, but I thought the sauce was overwhelming the rest of the roll.
chicken udon.author: Rachel E.
chicken udon.review:
My sister and I came for dinner around 7:30 on Saturday night. It was empty when we arrived which made us a little nervous, but we decided to give it a shot. The restaurant did get significantly more crowded as it got a little later, but seems like at any time there's no wait for a table.

They brought out edamame and water as soon as we sat down which was nice. Then we had the kamikaze roll, x roll, salmon sashimi, and chicken udon.

The kamikaze roll was very good. I'm a big spicy tuna fan to begin with though! The x roll was also delicious, but I thought the sauce was overwhelming the rest of the roll. 

The salmon sashimi was super fresh, it's clear the quality of the fish is really good. 

The udon was fantastic too! The broth was amazingly flavorful and the noodles were perfectly cooked. The chicken in it was nothing to write home about. I'll probably try the beef next time. (Seafood is a little too adventurous for me...)

Service was just ok (hence just 4 stars instead of 5). Our waitress came by very quickly after we were seated and asked if we were ready to order. We told her we needed just another minute, but didn't see her for at least 10... Then, midway through our meal we overheard her telling the table next to us about some specials that weren't on the menu. We didn't hear about any specials...

Also, the water guy kept filling my glass. Literally every time I took a sip. It got to the point where it was actually disruptive to the conversation.

I don't mean to end on a negative note because this is a solid sushi place with some inventive rolls, tasty fresh fish, and friendly servers.

excerpts: However, one of my friends ordered their tempura udon and that looked so good!
I was immediately regretful of my decision and wished I had ordered that!
tempura udon.author: Christina C.
tempura udon.review:
I've only been here once during lunch and they were closing in an hour. Two of my friends and I ordered from the lunch menu and the price is decent for a Japanese restaurant but I have to say that the portions are a bit on the smaller side. I got a bento box with 2 items; salmon shioyaki and tempura. It was good but nothing spectacular. My tempura came with a small slice of eggplant, small slice of zucchini, a piece of broccoli, a slice of sweet potato (I think), and one tempura shrimp including a small salad, rice, and miso soup. 

However, one of my friends ordered their tempura udon and that looked so good! I was immediately regretful of my decision and wished I had ordered that! She said it was very delicious and would recommend so my guess is that you would probably get more of a bang for your buck ordering the udon. 

The waiter was very kind and helpful though! I think I would try this place again for the udon but probably wouldn't go out of my way for it.

excerpts: Our other friend got the tempura udon, which came with a sizable portion of shrimp and veggie tempura.
His food looked really good -
tempura udon.author: Abby S.
tempura udon.review:
Food (4/5): I shared the snow roll and the chef's sashimi with a friend. Snow roll has tempura shrimp and unagi inside, and crab, tobiko, and unagi sauce on the outside. Great combination of textures and flavors! The roll was pretty big, too.

 The chef's sashimi came with 3 slices each of 6 types of fish (tuna, salmon, scallop, walu, squid (?), and hamachi). Tasted pretty fresh, but the slices were really small.

Our other friend got the tempura udon, which came with a sizable portion of shrimp and veggie tempura. His food looked really good - I wished I ordered that! 

Service (5/5): Free edamame! Portions are really tiny though and no refills. We called in fifteen minutes before arriving and they were nice enough to hold a table for us. Servers were attentive and took care of us!

Value (4/5): Udon at ~$11 is prob the most value on the menu, but rolls ($6-14) aren't bad either. The chef's sashimi was $35 for 18 smallish pieces, which is okay too.

excerpts: I ordered the Tempura Udon and the Beef Tataki.
Both were really tasty.
The udon noodles were light and had a great texture.
The tempura was fried perfectly - not greasy at all.
tempura udon.author: Michael T.
tempura udon.review:
I had a great experience here a couple of nights ago. (Mama Ji's was a madhouse, so we decided to try this place instead.)

There were three of us and they seated us right away. They gave us a good amount of time to absorb the menu (many options), and were on the whole very attentive. 

I ordered the Tempura Udon and the Beef Tataki. Both were really tasty. The udon noodles were light and had a great texture. The tempura was fried perfectly - not greasy at all. The tataki was just plain delicious. 

The price was right as well.

I live in the neighborhood and only frequent 5 or 6 places for dinner as many of the options here aren't very good. I was really, really impressed with this place and it's now on my list of go-to places in the Castro.

excerpts: got me (and my girlie friend) some baked mussels---garlic-y and cheesy, tempura udon--comforting!, tokyo breeze--light and breezy sushi, REAL california roll---which had a REAL crab.
tempura udon.author: Marc K.
tempura udon.review:
one of the last and few restaurants that i haven't tried around the castro area. definitely, a place to try and get your japanese fix on!

first, the place is so small and pretty intimiate, i should say. nice restroom, may i say? you can always tell a place on what kind of restroom they have. just sayin.

2nd, the food wasn't disappointing, at all! got me (and my girlie friend) some baked mussels---garlic-y and cheesy, tempura udon--comforting!, tokyo breeze--light and breezy sushi, REAL california roll---which had a REAL crab. overall, it was such a comforting dinner on a cold, SF night.

3rd, my girlie friend was happy enough to say that..they were playing authentic japanese pop music. AWESOMENESS! 

a worthwhile to visit all over over over.....A G A I N! ^_^

excerpts: - Tempura Udon (2 stars): I got this via delivery since I was craving noodles so might not be a right indicator of the actual dish.
But it didn't taste like anything special, and I would've liked a better assortment of tempura.
- Salmon sashimi appetizer (4 stars):
tempura udon.author: Jennifer L.
tempura udon.review:
Yummy neighborhood sushi joint 2 blocks away from me, what more could I ask for! I've eaten here about 4x now, and I've enjoyed every meal! 

Sashimi is always fresh, and they have a pretty good selection of food options to choose from. Here are some of the items I've had:
- Volcano Roll (5 stars): Eel/mango/tuna/salmon with some crispy flakes. Yum! Doesn't look like a traditional roll, but under all the crispy flakes, you'll find the delicious pieces of sushi, don't worry.
- Summer Roll (3.5 stars): A bit plain, but I like it when I'm trying to go for something simple and lighter since it's wrapped with soy paper and doesn't have any extravagant sauces on it.
- Dinosaur Roll (4 stars): Soft-shell crab goodness! Sometimes the soft shell crab is prepared better than others, but overall a solid roll.
- Spicy Tuna Hand Roll (5 stars): Good tuna with a perfect amount of spiciness.
- Eggplant Special (5 stars): Super delicious combo of scallop/eggplant/shrimp! Spicy miso sauce gives each bite a nice kick.
- Tempura Udon (2 stars): I got this via delivery since I was craving noodles so might not be a right indicator of the actual dish. But it didn't taste like anything special, and I would've liked a better assortment of tempura.
- Salmon sashimi appetizer (4 stars): Very smooth, but I usually let the bf eat all of this since it's his fave type of sashimi.

Additional pluses: I've never had to wait for a seat, and the prices are decent (prob can get out of here paying between $15-20/person). The restaurant provides free edamame beans before your meal (love it because I always feel cheated when places try to sell me a tiny plate of edamame for $5), and the waiters are super attentive in refilling tea. Seriously, I don't think my tea cup has ever gone empty... they definitely have some magic tea radar up in here.

excerpts: My partner had a tempura udon bowl that was ho hum, but I would definitely go back for the sushi.
Great service.
tempura udon.author: Lauren C.
tempura udon.review: Spicy Geisha roll was SO GOOD. My partner had a tempura udon bowl that was ho hum, but I would definitely go back for the sushi. Great service.

excerpts: My caterpillar sushi roll on the other hand was tasty.
I like how they use the bigger tobiko eggs instead of the tiny ones.
I would have liked more unagi sauce drizzled on the bottom.
It was rather skimpy, kinda like their unagi portions in it too.
The good part is the fresh avocado on top.
caterpillar.author: Pauline L.
caterpillar.review:
We came here for my mom's annual bday unagi donburi dinner, and my mom's hell bent on trying to find her ultimate unagi donburi experience in San Francisco. I had hoped this year unlike the other 2 years, we'd hit gold at Takara's, but, nope, it's strike three :( . At $18 a bowl, you'd think my mom would have at least liked something about the dish, but she disliked everything about it. She said the rice wasn't the short grain sushi type rice, and she got the tail end of the unagi with lots of bones and burnt bits on the edges, and not enough unagi sauce flavoring throughout the dish. Sigh...this pretty much sucks.

My caterpillar sushi roll on the other hand was tasty. I like how they use the bigger tobiko eggs instead of the tiny ones. I would have liked more unagi sauce drizzled on the bottom. It was rather skimpy, kinda like their unagi portions in it too. The good part is the fresh avocado on top. Very nice.

Jolene L. ordered 2 Aloha rolls specials...her favorite by far. It had sashimi tuna poke, and that's as much as ingredients I can remember...we also ordered the green tea ice cream served in a giant martini glass. I usually like green tea, but I thought it had a weird aftertaste finish, like eating a mouthful of lavender flowers. Yuck. At least my mom and Jolene L. ate it all. 

The wait staff was efficient, friendly and helpful which earns the extra star. They consistently gave great water and tea service. Parking is metered streets.

I am now in my mom's black list books... I can't go through another year giving her meh to blah unagi rice bowls for her birthday, I mean, what does it say when she'd rather eat unagi out of a tin can!?

excerpts: Most noteworthy was the Fire Ball, which is basically pieces of spicy tuna roll rolled into a ball, deep fried and covered with spicy mayo and other delicious sauces.
Prices are very reasonable as well.
Recommend it if you're in the area and craving sushi!
fire ball.author: Christine G.
fire ball.review:
This is a great local sushi spot in the Castro.  Really good, fresh rolls here!  

The ambience is pretty no-frills in the way a lower price-range sushi spot often is, but you can't really go wrong with anything food-wise.  Most noteworthy was the Fire Ball, which is basically pieces of spicy tuna roll rolled into a ball, deep fried and covered with spicy mayo and other delicious sauces.  Prices are very reasonable as well.  Recommend it if you're in the area and craving sushi!

excerpts: The Fire Ball rolls are oh so good.
Love this place and the staff !
fire ball.author: J B.
fire ball.review: Great friendly service. I recommend the appetizers. The Spicy Tuna wrapped in Shiso and fried is exceptional along with the Shishito Peppers; hot and amazing!  The Fire Ball rolls are oh so good.  Love this place and the staff !

excerpts: The Spicy Geisha and Dinosaur roles are also quite good.
dinosaur.author: Saminda W.
dinosaur.review: Takara is very solid and I've had good experiences both dining in and ordering from here.  The sushi is pretty good by Mission/Castro area standards, and they run a tight shop in terms of service.  The Volcano roll is a feast for the senses, a must-try if you're dining in.  The Spicy Geisha and Dinosaur roles are also quite good.

excerpts: Onto the food: I had the dinosaur roll and my girlfriend had the vegetable tempura.
I felt the price's were a bit steep and the portions to be underwhelming.
I was planning to ask for a menu for another set of rolls, however the Dinosaur roll didn't increase my appetite.
The fried crab was too dry and had very jerky-like texture to it.
The vegetable tempura it
what it is -- not sure how they can just charge $10
+ for it
dinosaur.author: Sargon J.
dinosaur.review:
The Verdict:
Good Miso soup and Decent Rolls, however you're coming here for the ambiance, food is overpriced for what it was. 
=============================================
Dropped in on a Wendesday 6:20pm I was craving sushi and this place was nearby Bi-Rite Creamery. 
The waitstaff is fairly attentive and I was welcomed in almost immediately.

Its not a large place, seats ~30 persons, once we were seated we were told to move since they wanted to reserve that one area for a large party at 7:30. I thought that was a bit odd, but reaffirmed that we would be finished before then. 

Onto the food: I had the dinosaur roll and my girlfriend had the vegetable tempura. I felt the price's were a bit steep and the portions to be underwhelming. I was planning to ask for a menu for another set of rolls, however the Dinosaur roll didn't increase my appetite. The fried crab was too dry and had very jerky-like texture to it. The vegetable tempura it what it is -- not sure how they can just charge $10+ for it but that isn't the point.

I do want to mention they have some really fresh ginger -- it was very potent and STRONK!

My experience:
Service : 3.5 / 5
It was meh, I think they had a new guy whom was pretty forgetful. Also being told to move shows that is some internal miscommunication occurring.
Food : 2.5 / 5
It wasn't bad per say but $30 for two mediocre rolls and one was a simple vegetarian roll? I definitely didn't feel like I got much value. 
Atmosphere: 4.5 / 5
Clean, well kept with a modern feel. I actually really liked the decor and the music too, however they were playing from an iPod (nothing wrong with that!) but the genre of music was inconsistent.


I feel that I have to draw attention to something unusual.... I was really taken-aback by how nice their bathroom was -- mainly the cleanliness & the large fresh sunflowers felt like I was in a home than a restaurant.

excerpts: Dinosaur rolls were orgasmic.
I would recommend a place at the bar
then you can watch the creation of these amazing sushi.
I have been to a lot of sushi restaurants in the US, in France and in Japan and this one is one the best I have tried.
dinosaur.author: Ruijan M.
dinosaur.review: Best sushi restaurant ever. The mood there is nice. Perfect for a date. Dinosaur rolls were orgasmic. I would recommend a place at the bar then you can watch the creation of these amazing sushi. I have been to a lot of sushi restaurants in the US, in France and in Japan and this one is one the best I have tried.

excerpts: The dinosaur roll was disappointing: the coating on the soft shell crab was thick and overcooked, overpowering the taste of the crab.
dinosaur.author: Glen G.
dinosaur.review:
A little underwhelmed by both the food and the service.

Although we were seated promptly after walking in, we weren't given menus. We waited several minutes while talking but menus didn't arrive; we tried catching the attention of a server but ended up grabbing menus from a neighboring table.

The dinosaur roll was disappointing: the coating on the soft shell crab was thick and overcooked, overpowering the taste of the crab. The summer roll was okay, but not overly memorable.

excerpts: - Dinosaur Roll (4 stars): Soft-shell crab goodness!

excerpts:
SF roll, chicken skins & oyster shooter...

The SF ROLL was fantastic, the chicken skins reminded me of pork rinds or cracklin, but the condiment with it was superb, something wasabi something...
sf roll.author: Stacie R.
sf roll.review:
SF roll, chicken skins & oyster shooter...

2nd visit on our sushi hopping. Better than the 1st. The SF ROLL was fantastic, the chicken skins reminded me of pork rinds or cracklin, but the condiment with it was superb, something wasabi something...

And, the oyster shooter was wonderful (if you like oysters & raw egg).

Weds evening @ 8pm we got right in & service was so nice & prompt. 

Bathrooms were clean too.

*draught note: they provide water w/o request & keep refilling even after you say no more.

Since service is so prompt, the wait won't be long do give it a try.

excerpts: I ordered the SF Roll and it was pretty good although not what I expected.
The pieces seemed a bit smaller than what I can otherwise find for the same price.
Not a great place for large groups.
There were about 6 of us total but we managed to fit in a corner.
I wouldn't recommend going with more than 4 people.
It was a nice place to try but probably wouldn't end up coming here again.
sf roll.author: April W.
sf roll.review: I decided to check out this place after reading some other decent yelp reviews. It is fairly small but has a good evening ambiance. Our waiter was timely and overall service was great. I ordered the SF Roll and it was pretty good although not what I expected. The pieces seemed a bit smaller than what I can otherwise find for the same price. Not a great place for large groups. There were about 6 of us total but we managed to fit in a corner. I wouldn't recommend going with more than 4 people. It was a nice place to try but probably wouldn't end up coming here again.

excerpts: I can't speak to the SF roll, since I usually get their chirashi-don, but their fish is consistently fresh and tasty, and their chirashi always has something new and interesting on it.
sf roll.author: Lily T.
sf roll.review:
A few months ago I broke down and went back to Takara - it's so convenient, and my sons love gyoza and sushi.  I was pleasantly surprised by how much it's improved.  I can't speak to the SF roll, since I usually get their chirashi-don, but their fish is consistently fresh and tasty, and their chirashi always has something new and interesting on it.  We usually do take out, but the servers are always wonderful with my sons, offering them water and edamame if we have to wait for our order to be ready.  

So: Go Takara!  I take back my two star review - you're my go-to take out sushi place in our 'hood!

excerpts: excellent sushi - friendly service - can get super busy - my favorite is the SF roll - delicious!
sf roll.author: Jeffrey S.
sf roll.review: excellent sushi - friendly service - can get super busy - my favorite is the SF roll - delicious!

excerpts: For thr main course, ordered kamikaze, Tokyo, and Volcano roll.
All delicious.
The sake yozushoju was sweet and tart.
Went down really well with the food.
Recommendation, make sure you make reservations.
Every person that came in after us at 7 pm had one.
kamikaze.author: Hoosie U.
kamikaze.review: Great food. Pretty good service given it was a Friday night. After things settled down, the waiters started coming over, frequently poured tea and followed up with additional request. Ordered agadashi tofu for appetizer. It could have used some seasoning but was hot and fresh out the kitchen. For thr main course, ordered kamikaze, Tokyo, and Volcano roll. All delicious. The sake yozushoju was sweet and tart. Went down really well with the food. Recommendation, make sure you make reservations. Every person that came in after us at 7 pm had one.

excerpts: Then we had the kamikaze roll, x roll, salmon sashimi, and chicken udon.
The kamikaze roll was very good.
I'm a big spicy tuna fan to begin with though!
The x roll was also delicious, but I thought the sauce was overwhelming the rest of the roll.

kamikaze.review:
My sister and I came for dinner around 7:30 on Saturday night. It was empty when we arrived which made us a little nervous, but we decided to give it a shot. The restaurant did get significantly more crowded as it got a little later, but seems like at any time there's no wait for a table.

The kamikaze roll was very good. I'm a big spicy tuna fan to begin with though! The x roll was also delicious, but I thought the sauce was overwhelming the rest of the roll. 

The salmon sashimi was super fresh, it's clear the quality of the fish is really good. 

The udon was fantastic too! The broth was amazingly flavorful and the noodles were perfectly cooked. The chicken in it was nothing to write home about. I'll probably try the beef next time. (Seafood is a little too adventurous for me...)

excerpts: I'd definitely recommend the Fire Cracker and Pink Dragon sushi rolls.
:P SCRUMPTULICIOUS!
pink dragon.author: Zen T.
pink dragon.review:
OHHHH YES. This place definitely deserves five stars. 

food - DELICIOUS
service - fast
ambiance - chill

I'd definitely recommend the Fire Cracker and Pink Dragon sushi rolls. :P SCRUMPTULICIOUS!

excerpts:
like a volcano....
and the pink dragon roll is really good, i've ordered it unbaked too

salmon nigiri has always been fresh
watch out for meter maids when you park tho...
pink dragon.author: Anais B.
pink dragon.review:
i've eaten inside the restaurant and gotten delivery too. They are really attentive to the customer in the restaurant, i've always had excellent fast service, and they have always delivered fresh and hot food on time. 
I really like their volcano roll, the mango is a nice sweet touch and tempura crunchies are nice and hot while the roll is fresh, great contrast, plus its looks crazy. like a volcano....
and the pink dragon roll is really good, i've ordered it unbaked too
salmon nigiri has always been fresh
watch out for meter maids when you park tho...

excerpts: I had the X Roll, Red Dragon, and Pink Dragon.
All were really good!
I like lots of flavors in my sushi rolls and this totally hit the spot.
Delivery was faster than expected, too.
I would recommend for sure.
pink dragon.author: Rebeccah Y.
pink dragon.review: I had the X Roll, Red Dragon, and Pink Dragon. All were really good! I like lots of flavors in my sushi rolls and this totally hit the spot. Delivery was faster than expected, too. I would recommend for sure.

excerpts: I ordered an oyster shooter and the Pumpkin for myself.
I was iffy about the Pumpkin because the dish only comes in two pieces....but after eating it,  was not disappointed.
The pieces are large and are succulent fish wise.
The fish if very fresh and tasty!
pumpkin.author: Sofia R.
pumpkin.review:
A bunch of friends and I decided to grab dinner here. I chose this place because I walked past it one day while I was looking for a cafe. It looked promising so I kept it bookmarked. 

I was not disappointed. The place itself is small in space, but still nice inside. Very traditional Japanese. The workers are friendly and are way too good at refilling our drinks.

I ordered an oyster shooter and the Pumpkin for myself. I was iffy about the Pumpkin because the dish only comes in two pieces....but after eating it,  was not disappointed. The pieces are large and are succulent fish wise. The fish if very fresh and tasty! I enjoyed every single bite. 

The oyster shooter was good too. I actually took this first. I wasn't really sure what to expect but it's basically a shot of sake, raw oyster, quail egg, and shallots. I've never had sake before but my friends scared me into thinking I'd definitely throw it up. On the contrary, it was quite tasty. I mean, shots aren't meant to be savored, but the aftertaste was actually good. 

My friends enjoyed the dishes they got too. One friend got the summer roll which seemed special because it's wrapped with soy instead of nori, but it wasn't that great to me.

By the end of our meal, we decided to order the mochi sampler. $8 for 3 mochis is expensive, but the quality of the ice cream mochi we got was really good. We chose to get green tea, red bean, and mango. They were nice enough to cut it into fours, assuming we were all sharing. Our of all the flavors, I liked mango the best...and I don't typically like mango. 

Overall, wonderful sushi joint. I'm pretty picky with sushi and I think I consider this my favorite thus far.

excerpts: The Pumpkin, Salmon Lover, Hamachi Nigiri, and the Maguro Tataki Salad were all delicious.
However, I felt the Pumpkin was overpriced.
They could have also been a little more generous with the size of the Salmon Lover.
3.5/4 stars overall.
pumpkin.author: Melanie N.
pumpkin.review: Our plate of complimentary edamame had 9 pieces. When the guest next to us sat down, they were given an entire bowl. The "hot" tea was room temperature and wasn't stepped long enough. My refill later was hot, but again flavorless. Yes, I know these two things were "free", but my thing is, if you're going to do it, do it right and be consistent. Although the servers were friendly, they came around way too much refilling our drinks. Different servers came by one after the other every 3 minutes. The Pumpkin, Salmon Lover, Hamachi Nigiri, and the Maguro Tataki Salad were all delicious. However, I felt the Pumpkin was overpriced. They could have also been a little more generous with the size of the Salmon Lover. 3.5/4 stars overall.

excerpts: Try the pumpkin roll - spicy scallop with succulent salmon wrapped around; or the Japonese with the crunchy cracker base.
Love the dark wood decor, gave the place a high-end feel.
The staff were very helpful with the birthday cake we brought.
Thanks Takara!
pumpkin.author: Teresa S.
pumpkin.review: Nice place, great food, great service!!  We had a really good time, thanks in part to our server Betty.  She was really fun.  Miso soup with clams was delicious and an unusual offering.  Sushi presentations were beautiful.  Fresh wasabi - we couldn't get enough!  Freshest, crispiest tempura ever!!  Try the pumpkin roll - spicy scallop with succulent salmon wrapped around; or the Japonese with the crunchy cracker base.  Love the dark wood decor, gave the place a high-end feel.  The staff were very helpful with the birthday cake we brought.  Thanks Takara!

excerpts: My favorite rolls are the crazy roll and the red dragon roll.
Their fish is always fresh (wel all of the fish I've had was).
The miso is also pretty darn good.
red dragon.author: Sarah P.
red dragon.review:
I've been here a few times and I never leave disappointed. My favorite rolls are the crazy roll and the red dragon roll. Their fish is always fresh (wel all of the fish I've had was). The miso is also pretty darn good. Service is always great, as well. 

The only thing on my wish list would be some sort of waiting area... I understand space is limited, but standing in the same area people are eating and vice versa is uncomfortable. 

Overall, I would recommend this to my friends and family, and I'll be back!

excerpts: I ordered the spicy tuna roll, red dragon roll, and miso soup.
The rolls were just okay.
The tuna didn't have much flavor.
The rice was cooked well however.
The price point for the sushi was pretty average for San Francisco standards.
I would give Takara another shot and try something different next time.
red dragon.author: Josh S.
red dragon.review: Takara has friendly and attentive staff in a comfortable and cool looking restaurant.  The inside has two levels - the floor has tables by the front windows and the raised level up the steps opens up to a larger dining area.  I ordered the spicy tuna roll, red dragon roll, and miso soup.  The rolls were just okay.  The tuna didn't have much flavor.  The rice was cooked well however.  The price point for the sushi was pretty average for San Francisco standards.  I would give Takara another shot and try something different next time.

excerpts: I had the X Roll, Red Dragon, and Pink Dragon.
All were really good!
I like lots of flavors in my sushi rolls and this totally hit the spot.
Delivery was faster than expected, too.
I would recommend for sure.
red dragon.author: Rebeccah Y.
red dragon.review: I had the X Roll, Red Dragon, and Pink Dragon. All were really good! I like lots of flavors in my sushi rolls and this totally hit the spot. Delivery was faster than expected, too. I would recommend for sure.

excerpts: I'd recommend the crazy roll, snow crab leg, red dragon and definitely an Asahi Black for the beer drinkers.
Staff are attentive and the sushi is always immaculately presented.
Can get busy but they do take reservations.
red dragon.author: Paul P.
red dragon.review: We eat here probably once a week and think it's excellent. I'd recommend the crazy roll, snow crab leg, red dragon and definitely an Asahi Black for the beer drinkers. Staff are attentive and the sushi is always immaculately presented. Can get busy but they do take reservations.

excerpts: The red dragon roll was delicious and well presented, the extra orders of salmon nagiri were quick to come out and offered plenty of fresh salmon.
red dragon.author: Mike W.
red dragon.review:
I really shouldn't complain, but for full disclosure, the *free* tea was weak, and the *free* edamame to start was cold.

The red dragon roll was delicious and well presented, the extra orders of salmon nagiri were quick to come out and offered plenty of fresh salmon.

The staff was friendly, and they kept the water filled.

excerpts: Ordered the Volcano Roll and the Salmon Lover Roll .
Did not disappoint .
Definitely would recommend this place .
salmon lover.author: Sky C.
salmon lover.review: Ordered the Volcano Roll and the Salmon Lover Roll . Did not disappoint . Definitely would recommend this place . The service and ambiance was remarkable and I found it pretty cool how they served edamame as a little appetizer for free . Total was about $30 including tip . Overall great experience

Overall I paid almost $60 per person and I found the fish portions very cheap

3.5/4 stars overall.

The "hot" tea was room temperature and wasn't stepped long enough. My refill later was hot, but again flavorless. excerpts: we had some rolls:  crazy, salmon lover, and another one i cant remember the name of.
all of them were good!
salmon lover.author: claudia y.
salmon lover.review:
we did a mini pre-bday celebration here with another couple and was presently suprised at the food.  this place is run by chinese people but the food is good.  i want to come back and try more of the nigiri and sashimi.  

we had some rolls:  crazy, salmon lover, and another one i cant remember the name of.  all of them were good!  we also ordered hamachi kama which was huge!  and also the miso seabass that came with 3 or 4? pieces! it was a lot of food.

i thought service was excellent as they kept coming by to check up and refill our teas and water.

parking in this neighborhood can be difficult though

excerpts: I shared the snow roll and the chef's sashimi with a friend.
Snow roll has tempura shrimp and unagi inside, and crab, tobiko, and unagi sauce on the outside.
Great combination of textures and flavors!
snow roll.author: Abby S.
snow roll.review:
Food (4/5): I shared the snow roll and the chef's sashimi with a friend. Snow roll has tempura shrimp and unagi inside, and crab, tobiko, and unagi sauce on the outside. Great combination of textures and flavors! The roll was pretty big, too.

 The chef's sashimi came with 3 slices each of 6 types of fish (tuna, salmon, scallop, walu, squid (?), and hamachi). Tasted pretty fresh, but the slices were really small.

Our other friend got the tempura udon, which came with a sizable portion of shrimp and veggie tempura. His food looked really good - I wished I ordered that! 

Service (5/5): Free edamame! Portions are really tiny though and no refills. We called in fifteen minutes before arriving and they were nice enough to hold a table for us. Servers were attentive and took care of us!

Value (4/5): Udon at ~$11 is prob the most value on the menu, but rolls ($6-14) aren't bad either. The chef's sashimi was $35 for 18 smallish pieces, which is okay too.

excerpts: The Spicy Geisha and Dinosaur roles are also quite good.
spicy geisha.author: Saminda W.
spicy geisha.review: Takara is very solid and I've had good experiences both dining in and ordering from here.  The sushi is pretty good by Mission/Castro area standards, and they run a tight shop in terms of service.  The Volcano roll is a feast for the senses, a must-try if you're dining in.  The Spicy Geisha and Dinosaur roles are also quite good.

excerpts: Spicy Geisha!!
spicy geisha.author: Roberto G.
spicy geisha.review: Amazing sushi with great service. Always a favorite. Their specials have never dissapointed. Spicy Geisha!!

excerpts: Their Volcano roll and Spicy geisha roll were amazing!
Their flavors are unbelievable and their service is excellent!
I will definitely be back!
spicy geisha.author: Arieana G.
spicy geisha.review: Takara has some of the freshest rolls I have ever tasted! Their Volcano roll and Spicy geisha roll were amazing! Their flavors are unbelievable and their service is excellent! I will definitely be back!

excerpts: Spicy Geisha roll was SO GOOD.
spicy geisha.author: Lauren C.
spicy geisha.review: Spicy Geisha roll was SO GOOD. My partner had a tempura udon bowl that was ho hum, but I would definitely go back for the sushi. Great service.

excerpts: We had the x-roll, summer roll, rainbow roll and the special roll of the night.
My wife enjoyed the hamachi kama and my daughter loved her udon noodles.
summer roll.author: Zen D.
summer roll.review: We had some excellent sushi here tonight.  They carry gluten free soy sauce and are very good at letting you know what you are safe eating here.  We had the x-roll, summer roll, rainbow roll and the special roll of the night.  My wife enjoyed the hamachi kama and my daughter loved her udon noodles.

excerpts: One friend got the summer roll which seemed special because it's wrapped with soy instead of nori, but it wasn't that great to me.
summer roll.author: Sofia R.
summer roll.review:
A bunch of friends and I decided to grab dinner here. I chose this place because I walked past it one day while I was looking for a cafe. It looked promising so I kept it bookmarked. 

I was not disappointed. The place itself is small in space, but still nice inside. Very traditional Japanese. The workers are friendly and are way too good at refilling our drinks.

I ordered an oyster shooter and the Pumpkin for myself. I was iffy about the Pumpkin because the dish only comes in two pieces....but after eating it,  was not disappointed. The pieces are large and are succulent fish wise. The fish if very fresh and tasty! I enjoyed every single bite. 

The oyster shooter was good too. I actually took this first. I wasn't really sure what to expect but it's basically a shot of sake, raw oyster, quail egg, and shallots. I've never had sake before but my friends scared me into thinking I'd definitely throw it up. On the contrary, it was quite tasty. I mean, shots aren't meant to be savored, but the aftertaste was actually good. 

My friends enjoyed the dishes they got too. One friend got the summer roll which seemed special because it's wrapped with soy instead of nori, but it wasn't that great to me.

By the end of our meal, we decided to order the mochi sampler. $8 for 3 mochis is expensive, but the quality of the ice cream mochi we got was really good. We chose to get green tea, red bean, and mango. They were nice enough to cut it into fours, assuming we were all sharing. Our of all the flavors, I liked mango the best...and I don't typically like mango. 

Overall, wonderful sushi joint. I'm pretty picky with sushi and I think I consider this my favorite thus far.

excerpts: - Summer Roll: Fresh, and clean.
The salmon is complimented well with the escolar for a nice tasty treat
- X-Roll:
Very good, but the spicy sauce seemed a little but much.
The Bomb:
summer roll.author: Natalie G.
summer roll.review:
Fresh sushi, easy crowd.

We were a walk-in on a Tuesday evening, and it was pretty busy at 7:30 pm. Fortunately, we only waited 10 minutes to be seated.  Overall, the sushi was fresh and tasty:  

- Summer Roll: Fresh, and clean. The salmon is complimented well with the escolar for a nice tasty treat
- X-Roll: Very good, but the spicy sauce seemed a little but much.
- The Bomb: It had a lot going on, but it was fresh and well balanced.

Nice vibe, small tables.  It is busy, so definitely worth it to get reservations in advance.

excerpts: The summer roll was okay, but not overly memorable.
summer roll.author: Glen G.
summer roll.review:
A little underwhelmed by both the food and the service.

Although we were seated promptly after walking in, we weren't given menus. We waited several minutes while talking but menus didn't arrive; we tried catching the attention of a server but ended up grabbing menus from a neighboring table.

The dinosaur roll was disappointing: the coating on the soft shell crab was thick and overcooked, overpowering the taste of the crab. The summer roll was okay, but not overly memorable.

excerpts: The summer roll was very fresh and the bomb was delicious.
summer roll.author: Carrie Y.
summer roll.review: Delicious sushi spot. I'm not in the castro too often, actually, NEVER. But discovered this place while walking by with a friend and decided to check it out after a long day of grocery shopping at Whole Foods. The summer roll was very fresh and the bomb was delicious.

excerpts: - Summer Roll (3.5 stars):
A bit plain, but I like it when I'm trying to go for something simple and lighter since it's wrapped with soy paper and doesn't have any extravagant sauces on it.
summer roll.author: Jennifer L.
summer roll.review:
Yummy neighborhood sushi joint 2 blocks away from me, what more could I ask for! I've eaten here about 4x now, and I've enjoyed every meal! 

Sashimi is always fresh, and they have a pretty good selection of food options to choose from. Here are some of the items I've had:
- Volcano Roll (5 stars): Eel/mango/tuna/salmon with some crispy flakes. Yum! Doesn't look like a traditional roll, but under all the crispy flakes, you'll find the delicious pieces of sushi, don't worry.
- Summer Roll (3.5 stars): A bit plain, but I like it when I'm trying to go for something simple and lighter since it's wrapped with soy paper and doesn't have any extravagant sauces on it.
- Dinosaur Roll (4 stars): Soft-shell crab goodness! Sometimes the soft shell crab is prepared better than others, but overall a solid roll.
- Spicy Tuna Hand Roll (5 stars): Good tuna with a perfect amount of spiciness.
- Eggplant Special (5 stars): Super delicious combo of scallop/eggplant/shrimp! Spicy miso sauce gives each bite a nice kick.
- Tempura Udon (2 stars): I got this via delivery since I was craving noodles so might not be a right indicator of the actual dish. But it didn't taste like anything special, and I would've liked a better assortment of tempura.
- Salmon sashimi appetizer (4 stars): Very smooth, but I usually let the bf eat all of this since it's his fave type of sashimi.

Additional pluses: I've never had to wait for a seat, and the prices are decent (prob can get out of here paying between $15-20/person). The restaurant provides free edamame beans before your meal (love it because I always feel cheated when places try to sell me a tiny plate of edamame for $5), and the waiters are super attentive in refilling tea. Seriously, I don't think my tea cup has ever gone empty... they definitely have some magic tea radar up in here.

excerpts: I love their Tokyo breeze and their specials are always on point
tokyo breeze.author: Chantel B.
tokyo breeze.review:
Best sushi in the Castro hands down. I come here every couple weeks and love it! Fresh fish and friendly staff. 
I love their Tokyo breeze and their specials are always on point

My mom loved the Tsunami roll- Unagi, unagi, and more unagi. 
And some cream cheese.
The stand-out for me was Tokyo Breeze.

Lemon, sea salt, and wasabi was the perfect combination.
It was light and refreshing and perfect!!!

tokyo breeze.review:
My mom and I came here for my birthday dinner and it is officially our new favorite sushi restaurant!
We got the Tsunami Roll, the X-Roll, and the Tokyo Breeze roll.

My mom loved the Tsunami roll- Unagi, unagi, and more unagi. And some cream cheese.
The stand-out for me was Tokyo Breeze.

It was light and refreshing and perfect!!!
We will absolutely be coming back here many times.

EAT AT THIS RESTAURANT!!!!

excerpts: Our staples are tokyo breeze, x roll, and maguro ngiri.
tokyo breeze.author: Ilana B.
tokyo breeze.review: This place is consistently good. My roommates and I have a sushi delivery addiction and Takara satisfies our cravings on a weekly basis. Sometimes the delivery takes a while, but hey, that's what you get when you're too lazy to go to the restaurant I guess. Our staples are tokyo breeze, x roll, and maguro ngiri.

excerpts: Tokyo breeze was ok...
surprise roe on top that we had been trying to avoid...
tokyo breeze.author: Christine H.
tokyo breeze.review:
Favorite part was the dancing spicy shrimp. They weren't actually very spicy but the tempura batter was perfect.

Tokyo breeze was ok...surprise roe on top that we had been trying to avoid...:/

Also tried the yummy roll and it was pretty good.

Nothing too amazing but no wait on a Saturday night and good service. mmmmm Tempura.

excerpts: I got the Tokyo Breeze, which had pretty good reviews on Yelp.
It had avocado and lemon with tuna on top.
They also season the roll with sesame oil and salt, which I thought was interesting.
It tasted really weird though.
The tuna was fresh, but the lemon just completely threw off the taste of the roll.
It was incredibly sour.
My friend had a bite of mine and made a weird face.
tokyo breeze.author: Christina L.
tokyo breeze.review:
Why is there such huge rating inflations for Asian food in the Castro? It's so terrible. Mama Ji's is overpriced and bad, and this place is no different.

I got the Tokyo Breeze, which had pretty good reviews on Yelp. It had avocado and lemon with tuna on top. They also season the roll with sesame oil and salt, which I thought was interesting. It tasted really weird though. The tuna was fresh, but the lemon just completely threw off the taste of the roll. It was incredibly sour. My friend had a bite of mine and made a weird face. It's very unexpectedly sour so beware. 

My friend got the chicken teriyaki dinner plate. It was very meh. Just a ton of chicken with rice and a side salad and miso soup. No cooked veggies or any kind of garnish.

We also got beer-- they have Asahi Black!!! If you've never tried it before, you have to get it. They poured it into this long fancy cup which looked nice. When we were done, we each asked for another one, and the waitress only came out with one beer
and strangely, she poured half into each of our cups and walked away before we could ask for another one... This was super weird. It's as if she was trying to restrict our alcohol consumption or something lol. We definitely made it really clear that we each wanted another beer... why would we want to share one???! On top of that, she immediately came out with the check which made us uncomfortable since we just got our drinks and wanted to enjoy it. And then 5 minutes later (we hadn't paid yet), she came back to our table and was like oops sorry and took the check away and then brought it back a couple of minutes later. I assume she forgot to add the beer in there or something.

Anyway, this was a super weird experience and a pretty mediocre meal. Only reason I'm giving it 2 stars instead of one is because they have Asahi Black.

excerpts: My favorite roll is the Tokyo Breeze.
tokyo breeze.author: G B.
tokyo breeze.review:
I've had both lunch and dinner here six times in the past year...and plan to keep going!

Ambiance:  Warm and relaxed.

Service: Friendly and very accommodating for food allergies.

Food (gluten-free dairy-free perspective): The freshness of the seafood can be hit or miss but always within the range of fresh.  My favorite roll is the Tokyo Breeze.  I also order the Takami Edamame with olive oil instead of butter.  The wait staff is always very accommodating, willing to modify rolls or let you know which rolls are standard gluten-free.  They also provide gluten-free tamari soy sauce.

Tokyo Breeze
Fire Cracker
Volcano Roll

Love this place, never lets me down.

My fav Sushi spot if you want a chill, cozy atmosphere with sophistication...

BEST ROLLS!!

Tokyo Breeze
Fire Cracker
Volcano Roll

Love this place, never lets me down.

one of the last and few restaurants that i haven't tried around the castro area. definitely, a place to try and get your japanese fix on!

first, the place is so small and pretty intimiate, i should say. nice restroom, may i say? you can always tell a place on what kind of restroom they have. just sayin.

2nd, the food wasn't disappointing, at all! got me (and my girlie friend) some baked mussels---garlic-y and cheesy, tempura udon--comforting!, tokyo breeze--light and breezy sushi, REAL california roll---which had a REAL crab. overall, it was such a comforting dinner on a cold, SF night.

3rd, my girlie friend was happy enough to say that..they were playing authentic japanese pop music. AWESOMENESS! 

a worthwhile to visit all over over over.....A G A I N! ^_^

excerpts: The yummy roll and Tokyo breeze rolls were excellent, and I'm so happy to find a place that serves great escolar sashimi.

tokyo breeze.review: The yummy roll and Tokyo breeze rolls were excellent, and I'm so happy to find a place that serves great escolar sashimi.

Service was quick and incredibly friendly.

excerpts: The tsunami roll is very tasty and the last thing I will say is that this place is not run like a Mc donalds where you are treated like an insignificant number like Osaka Sushi is.
tsunami.author: Mike R.
tsunami.review:
EXCELLENT!! 

They always remember me when I come in and even my order. I seriously asked them a month later: "what was the roll my friend got who was allergic to dairy?"  They remembered! One hand almost creepy, on the other I can't judge them rudely  if they are that smart and attentive. Extremely friendly and will almost run to your table to remove your straw wrapper when you set it down. I was at Costco in my "get-me-the-fuck-out-of-this-line-so-I-can-sit-and-enjoy-my-hot-dog-daze when one of the waiters came up to me and said hi and asked me how I was off the clock!! Excellence is excellent and the staff is very humble and its heartwarming. I feel as though this place is ran in such a way that they are proud to be open and running. You have got to see their bathroom sink too its HELLA cool!!!! The tsunami roll is very tasty and the last thing I will say is that this place is not run like a Mc donalds where you are treated like an insignificant number like Osaka Sushi is.

excerpts: I ordered Sake, Volcano Roll and Yummy role.
volcano roll.author: Jonathan B.
volcano roll.review:
Came here around closing and it was still buzzing with people! Located off Castro this sushi place is my favorite in the Bay Area, it was my 5th time going here!

When I went here last I sat at the window seat which has a great view of the road and one of the two TVs in the restaurant, and they where playing the Clippers game at the time.

I ordered Sake, Volcano Roll and Yummy role. I strongly recommend to get the yummy and volcano rolls if you like crunchy flakes.

Service was quick and efficient, very friendly and brought out the food pretty quickly. I would strongly recommend this place if you want to try a very good sushi place that has high quality sushi at a good price!

excerpts: Went here to try their Volcano Roll.
It was delicious and my wallet didn't suffer!
Definitely going to go back to try other items from their menu.

volcano roll.review: Went here to try their Volcano Roll.It was delicious and my wallet didn't suffer! Definitely going to go back to try other items from their menu.
