excerpts: For thr main course, ordered kamikaze, Tokyo, and Volcano roll.
All delicious.
The sake yozushoju was sweet and tart.
Went down really well with the food.
Recommendation, make sure you make reservations.
Every person that came in after us at 7 pm had one.
volcano roll.author: Hoosie U.
volcano roll.review: Great food. Pretty good service given it was a Friday night. After things settled down, the waiters started coming over, frequently poured tea and followed up with additional request. Ordered agadashi tofu for appetizer. It could have used some seasoning but was hot and fresh out the kitchen. For thr main course, ordered kamikaze, Tokyo, and Volcano roll. All delicious. The sake yozushoju was sweet and tart. Went down really well with the food. Recommendation, make sure you make reservations. Every person that came in after us at 7 pm had one.

excerpts: I really like their volcano roll, the mango is a nice sweet touch and tempura crunchies are nice and hot while the roll is fresh, great contrast, plus its looks crazy.
volcano roll.author: Anais B.
volcano roll.review:
i've eaten inside the restaurant and gotten delivery too. They are really attentive to the customer in the restaurant, i've always had excellent fast service, and they have always delivered fresh and hot food on time. 
I really like their volcano roll, the mango is a nice sweet touch and tempura crunchies are nice and hot while the roll is fresh, great contrast, plus its looks crazy. like a volcano....
and the pink dragon roll is really good, i've ordered it unbaked too
salmon nigiri has always been fresh
watch out for meter maids when you park tho...

excerpts: The volcano roll was a bit unusual though.
volcano roll.author: Kenson K.
volcano roll.review:
Came here to eat after bar hopping during happy hour on sunny Sunday Funday. For Americanized sushi, its decent. We ordered a bunch of rolls. They were ok. The volcano roll was a bit unusual though. It was a roll covered in deep fried panko; a bit different. 

I didn't have a chance to order the nigiri sushi so I cant attest to the freshness of their nigiri. I would've been a little more critical on that if I tried it since I am a traditionalist when it comes to eating sushi and sashimi. However, their rolls were pretty decent.

excerpts: The rainbow roll and volcano roll were definitely the standouts of the meal.
volcano roll.author: Mandy L.
volcano roll.review: Great sushi! Simple combinations that yielded excellent taste results. We weren't looking for anything extravagantly cooked or doused in sauce, and we were greatly satisfied with our experience here! The rainbow roll and volcano roll were definitely the standouts of the meal.

excerpts: The volcano roll is a good one for crunchy fried sweet bits and Tokyo roll is super fresh with lemon and avocado.
They are adamant about not using soy sauce on their pre sauced rolls.
It's very sweet when a wait staff takes so much pride in their chefs' work.
We always go back.
Thanks Takara.
volcano roll.author: Audra S.
volcano roll.review: One of our favorite hood go to spots. Great service, fresh fish. Ask for the recommendations of the day to get the super fresh fish cuts. We had the king salmon nigiri and it was like butter. The toro with truffle salt was lovely but I didn't taste any truffle. Love their seaweed salad, which was complimented well by the house hot sake. Aloha roll was memorable. The volcano roll is a good one for crunchy fried sweet bits and Tokyo roll is super fresh with lemon and avocado. They are adamant about not using soy sauce on their pre sauced rolls. It's very sweet when a wait staff takes so much pride in their chefs' work. We always go back. Thanks Takara.

excerpts: Two standout dishes are the Volcano Roll, which is eel with an amazing crunchy panko, and the Albacore Carpaccio is fresh and delicious.
And yay they start delivering next month!!!
So needless to say I love love love.
volcano roll.author: Diana B.
volcano roll.review:
If I could give this place a 10, I totally would. My boyfriend and I started going here about 6 months ago and have been going about twice a month ever since. The server and the sushi chef are incredibly nice and helpful and always seem excited to see us and ask how we've been. They always recommend something new and have yet to disappoint us. 
Two standout dishes are the Volcano Roll, which is eel with an amazing crunchy panko, and the Albacore Carpaccio is fresh and delicious. And yay they start delivering next month!!! So needless to say I love love love.

excerpts: We ordered the volcano roll which I really enjoyed.
volcano roll.author: John S.
volcano roll.review:
I got take out from Takara last weekend and was very happy overall with this small sushi restaurant in my new neighborhood.  

We ordered the volcano roll which I really enjoyed.  We also got a California roll, tempura roll and goyza.  Everything tasted good and was definitely fresh, we especially enjoyed the rolls with tempura.  

The staff was very nice.  The only downside was we had to wait 15 minutes for our order once we arrived to pick it up and the restaurant was cramped with no where to stand.

excerpts: I also had the Volcano Roll which is served in a giant heap covered in delicious crunchy temporar shavings and a spicy-esqe sauce.
volcano roll.author: Chloé M.
volcano roll.review:
Went here for dinner late on a Saturday night. 
It's a cute, small place that randomly plays top 40 dance music? Probably an influence of being located in the heart of the Castro.

I had the gyoza, which was totally standard and satisfactory. 
I also had the Volcano Roll which is served in a giant heap covered in delicious crunchy temporar shavings and a spicy-esqe sauce. The menu lists mango...but I did not taste/see any mango on the dish. 

My mother sister bother ordered the sea bass and raved about it. 
We ordered the house hot saki which was decent. 

Would definitely go back when in the mood for good, classic sushi.

excerpts:
Tokyo Breeze
Fire Cracker
Volcano Roll

Love this place, never lets me down.
volcano roll.author: Rollio R.
volcano roll.review:
My fav Sushi spot if you want a chill, cozy atmosphere with sophistication...

BEST ROLLS!!

Tokyo Breeze
Fire Cracker
Volcano Roll

Love this place, never lets me down.

excerpts: The Volcano roll is also super fantastic.
volcano roll.author: Jason C.
volcano roll.review:
Takara is the absolute best sushi in San Francisco and probably anywhere.  The staff are super friendly and always aim to please.  They've only been open 2 months so far and are very eager to strut their stuff in the local restaurant scene.  

Quick Tips...

1. They're closed on Tuesdays.
2.  Have the Firecracker roll if you dig spicy + sushi.
3.  The Volcano roll is also super fantastic.

LOVE this place!

excerpts: You must tried their volcano roll.
Its a
must order dish in this lovely place.
(I saw this dish on every table)
volcano roll.author: Raging D.
volcano roll.review:
Super friendly staff in this small and warm sushi place.

You must tried their volcano roll.  Its a must order dish in this lovely place. (I saw this dish on every table)

excerpts: THEIR VOLCANO ROLL IS THE MOST DELICIOUS THING MY MOUTH
HAS EVER TASTED!!!!!
From the crispness of the tempura to the juiciness and freshness of the sushi, to the wonderful presentation...
SOOOO GOOD
Thank your VOLCANO roll.
Best in town.
volcano roll.author: NC B.
volcano roll.review:
This place has no seating, it is overly quiet, and is by far the smallest restaurant I have ever dined in....

But I really couldn't care less because their sushi is absolutely unrealistically DELICIOUS!!

PROS:

1. Love their comp edamame they give you upon seating (they will refuse to give a refill ..bah
2. THEIR VOLCANO ROLL IS THE MOST DELICIOUS THING MY MOUTH HAS EVER TASTED!!!!! From the crispness of the tempura to the juiciness and freshness of the sushi, to the wonderful presentation... SOOOO GOOD
3.their Philly roll is super yummy as well as their avocado roll...

CONS:
1. How can this joint not have HAPPY HOUR!!! Wtf. What a disappointment...
2. Location is very small and cozy and the awkward silence does not help... It's called music and you simply hit the ON button.

But again I really don't care.. This place deserves 5 stars all the way. Thank your VOLCANO roll. Best in town.

excerpts: The volcano roll was really creative and fun.
volcano roll.author: Sarah A.
volcano roll.review:
I loved this sushi place! I have been trying to find a good sushi restaurant in the city, and this one really impressed me. The volcano roll was really creative and fun. The rest of the sushi rolls were just as good.

I also love the service here. They substituted avocado for mango without question. They were also just really nice and friendly. We gave them a big tip. :)

I'll definitely be back.

excerpts: The house rolls were awesome, the volcano roll blew us a way!
The nigiri and house rolls were all very good and above average, and for the location the price was not over the top.
The biggest con about this place was waiting too long to try it.
We will be back.
volcano roll.author: Mickey D.
volcano roll.review: Solid Sushi. Just tried it with the wife for the first time tonight.  Had a great time, felt special and ordered some of the specials, fatty tuna was one as was the oysters, both were fantastic, though a bit pricy. The house rolls were awesome, the volcano roll blew us a way!  The nigiri and house rolls were all very good and above average, and for the location the price was not over the top.  The biggest con about this place was waiting too long to try it.  We will be back.

excerpts:
Here are some of the items I've had:
- Volcano Roll (5 stars): Eel/mango/tuna/salmon with some crispy flakes.
Yum!
Doesn't look like a traditional roll, but under all the crispy flakes, you'll find the delicious pieces of sushi, don't worry.
volcano roll.author: Jennifer L.
volcano roll.review:
Yummy neighborhood sushi joint 2 blocks away from me, what more could I ask for! I've eaten here about 4x now, and I've enjoyed every meal! 

Sashimi is always fresh, and they have a pretty good selection of food options to choose from. Here are some of the items I've had:
- Volcano Roll (5 stars): Eel/mango/tuna/salmon with some crispy flakes. Yum! Doesn't look like a traditional roll, but under all the crispy flakes, you'll find the delicious pieces of sushi, don't worry.
- Summer Roll (3.5 stars): A bit plain, but I like it when I'm trying to go for something simple and lighter since it's wrapped with soy paper and doesn't have any extravagant sauces on it.
- Dinosaur Roll (4 stars): Soft-shell crab goodness! Sometimes the soft shell crab is prepared better than others, but overall a solid roll.
- Spicy Tuna Hand Roll (5 stars): Good tuna with a perfect amount of spiciness.
- Eggplant Special (5 stars): Super delicious combo of scallop/eggplant/shrimp! Spicy miso sauce gives each bite a nice kick.
- Tempura Udon (2 stars): I got this via delivery since I was craving noodles so might not be a right indicator of the actual dish. But it didn't taste like anything special, and I would've liked a better assortment of tempura.
- Salmon sashimi appetizer (4 stars): Very smooth, but I usually let the bf eat all of this since it's his fave type of sashimi.

Additional pluses: I've never had to wait for a seat, and the prices are decent (prob can get out of here paying between $15-20/person). The restaurant provides free edamame beans before your meal (love it because I always feel cheated when places try to sell me a tiny plate of edamame for $5), and the waiters are super attentive in refilling tea. Seriously, I don't think my tea cup has ever gone empty... they definitely have some magic tea radar up in here.

excerpts: Normally I'm a nigiri kind of guy, but I will say that Takara's volcano roll was amazing.
The wait isn't too bad and the wait staff is really nice.
Also, if I had to give a tip, check this place out during lunch for their lunch deals!
volcano roll.author: Ben T.
volcano roll.review: Been here a few times now. Convenient location in the heart of the Castro. Price/quality-wise, you get the same quality as you would get in most other places in SF for the same price (i.e. expect to pay $20+/person).  Normally I'm a nigiri kind of guy, but I will say that Takara's volcano roll was amazing.  The wait isn't too bad and the wait staff is really nice.  Also, if I had to give a tip, check this place out during lunch for their lunch deals! :)

excerpts: Try the volcano roll WOW!
Friendly service and a nice vibe, very cute!
volcano roll.author: Jake T.
volcano roll.review: A pleasant surprise indeed! If you are visiting the Castro Its worth a short walk down 18th. The food is DELICIOUS! Try the volcano roll WOW! Friendly service and a nice vibe, very cute!

excerpts: My favorite ..the volcano roll and salmon sashimi!!!
volcano roll.author: Jennie M.
volcano roll.review: Sushi is fresh and the service is always excellant!!! They have really unique rolls and the sashimi is always mouth watering! My favorite ..the volcano roll and salmon sashimi!!!

excerpts: Their Volcano roll and Spicy geisha roll were amazing!
Their flavors are unbelievable and their service is excellent!
I will definitely be back!
volcano roll.author: Arieana G.
volcano roll.review: Takara has some of the freshest rolls I have ever tasted! Their Volcano roll and Spicy geisha roll were amazing! Their flavors are unbelievable and their service is excellent! I will definitely be back!

excerpts: volcano roll and their seasoned edamame made the best appetizers.
prices are reasonable for the quality, every penny worth!
volcano roll.author: Michie Y.
volcano roll.review:
sashimi is super fresh there, my tai literally melted in my mouth. all others that i tried (uni, amaebi, salmon) were also very good (in taste and display). volcano roll and their seasoned edamame made the best appetizers. prices are reasonable for the quality, every penny worth! the owner and the people working at the sushi bar are also very friendly. 

this place is really for people that enjoy sushi. while there are many options where i can pay less for so-so rolls that can stuff my stomach, i would always come back for sushi.   

i think this place is even better than sushi ota in sd.

excerpts: Make sure you try the volcano roll!
volcano roll.author: Andrew W.
volcano roll.review: My favorite sushi restaurant in my neighborhood.  The sushi is always fresh, and the wait-staff is super friendly.  Make sure you try the volcano roll!

excerpts: The Volcano Roll and the Tokyo Breeze (or something) were delicious and very interesting.
Service was quick and incredibly friendly.
Portions were average to on the small side, so don't go here if you're very hungry and/or on a very tight budget!
volcano roll.author: Geoffrey U.
volcano roll.review: Shared four delicious rolls. The Volcano Roll and the Tokyo Breeze (or something) were delicious and very interesting. Service was quick and incredibly friendly. Portions were average to on the small side, so don't go here if you're very hungry and/or on a very tight budget!

excerpts: I had the X Roll, Red Dragon, and Pink Dragon.
All were really good!
I like lots of flavors in my sushi rolls and this totally hit the spot.
Delivery was faster than expected, too.
I would recommend for sure.
x roll.author: Rebeccah Y.
x roll.review: I had the X Roll, Red Dragon, and Pink Dragon. All were really good! I like lots of flavors in my sushi rolls and this totally hit the spot. Delivery was faster than expected, too. I would recommend for sure.

excerpts: Then we had the kamikaze roll, x roll, salmon sashimi, and chicken udon.
The kamikaze roll was very good.
I'm a big spicy tuna fan to begin with though!
The x roll was also delicious, but I thought the sauce was overwhelming the rest of the roll.
x roll.author: Rachel E.
x roll.review:
My sister and I came for dinner around 7:30 on Saturday night. It was empty when we arrived which made us a little nervous, but we decided to give it a shot. The restaurant did get significantly more crowded as it got a little later, but seems like at any time there's no wait for a table.

They brought out edamame and water as soon as we sat down which was nice. Then we had the kamikaze roll, x roll, salmon sashimi, and chicken udon.

The kamikaze roll was very good. I'm a big spicy tuna fan to begin with though! The x roll was also delicious, but I thought the sauce was overwhelming the rest of the roll. 

The salmon sashimi was super fresh, it's clear the quality of the fish is really good. 

The udon was fantastic too! The broth was amazingly flavorful and the noodles were perfectly cooked. The chicken in it was nothing to write home about. I'll probably try the beef next time. (Seafood is a little too adventurous for me...)

Service was just ok (hence just 4 stars instead of 5). Our waitress came by very quickly after we were seated and asked if we were ready to order. We told her we needed just another minute, but didn't see her for at least 10... Then, midway through our meal we overheard her telling the table next to us about some specials that weren't on the menu. We didn't hear about any specials...

Also, the water guy kept filling my glass. Literally every time I took a sip. It got to the point where it was actually disruptive to the conversation.

I don't mean to end on a negative note because this is a solid sushi place with some inventive rolls, tasty fresh fish, and friendly servers.

excerpts: Our staples are tokyo breeze, x roll, and maguro ngiri.
x roll.author: Ilana B.
x roll.review: This place is consistently good. My roommates and I have a sushi delivery addiction and Takara satisfies our cravings on a weekly basis. Sometimes the delivery takes a while, but hey, that's what you get when you're too lazy to go to the restaurant I guess. Our staples are tokyo breeze, x roll, and maguro ngiri.

excerpts: Dragon roll and the X roll are my two favorites!
Definitely one of the more attentive and affordable sushi spots in the neighborhood (:
x roll.author: Erin M.
x roll.review: Been here more than a few times, and every time is better than the last. Close proximity to my house and the Castro, the service is always impeccable and the fish is the freshest. Dragon roll and the X roll are my two favorites! Definitely one of the more attentive and affordable sushi spots in the neighborhood (:

excerpts: I'd definitely recommend the Fire Cracker and Pink Dragon sushi rolls.
:P SCRUMPTULICIOUS!
fire cracker.author: Zen T.
fire cracker.review:
OHHHH YES. This place definitely deserves five stars. 

food - DELICIOUS
service - fast
ambiance - chill

I'd definitely recommend the Fire Cracker and Pink Dragon sushi rolls. :P SCRUMPTULICIOUS!

Tokyo Breeze

Volcano Roll

BEST ROLLS!!

excerpts: The Fire Cracker roll was amazing, fried goodness.
I can't believe I ate two of them, neither could the waitress.
fire cracker.author: L D.
fire cracker.review: The Fire Cracker roll was amazing, fried goodness. I can't believe I ate two of them, neither could the waitress.

excerpts: The rolls are amazing, especially the "yummy roll", a must have!
They have a "special" board menu every day and they are happy to help you find a new fish to try.
yummy roll.author: Fabrice E.
yummy roll.review:
Really good sushi, small place, really friendly staff and chef.
The rolls are amazing, especially the "yummy roll", a must have! 
They have a "special" board menu every day and they are happy to help you find a new fish to try.

excerpts: Also tried the yummy roll and it was pretty good.
yummy roll.author: Christine H.
yummy roll.review:
Favorite part was the dancing spicy shrimp. They weren't actually very spicy but the tempura batter was perfect.

Tokyo breeze was ok...surprise roe on top that we had been trying to avoid...:/

Also tried the yummy roll and it was pretty good.

Nothing too amazing but no wait on a Saturday night and good service. mmmmm Tempura.

excerpts: The yummy roll and Tokyo breeze rolls were excellent, and I'm so happy to find a place that serves great escolar sashimi.
yummy roll.author: Chris N.
yummy roll.review: The yummy roll and Tokyo breeze rolls were excellent, and I'm so happy to find a place that serves great escolar sashimi.
